direction.raw_text: Hallo.  I am Andy.  Welcoom to my movie. (beat; he gets upset) I hoped the story of my life would be nice...but it turned out terrible!  It is all LIES!  Tings are mixed up... real people I knew play different people.  WHAT A MESS! So I broke into Universal and cut out the junk.  Now it's much shorter.  In fact, this is the end of the movie.  So tanks for comink! Bye-bye! Andy puts a needle on a phonograph, and swelling CLOSING CREDITS MUSIC starts to play.  FINAL CREDITS roll. Andy stands frozen, awkwardly looking at the audience. Every time the music ends he picks up the needle and restarts the music.  He does that as many times as the credits require. Finally, CREDITS END.  And then--a sly smile.  He leans in. DROPS HIS ACCENT and WHISPERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay!  Just my friends are left.  I wanted to get rid of those other people... they would have laughed in the wrong places. (beat) I was only kidding about the movie... it's actually PRETTY GOOD! It shows everything... from me as a little boy until my death -- (his eyes pop; he covers his mouth) Oops!!  I wasn't supposed to talk about that!  Oh.  Eh, uh, we better just begin.  It starts back in Great Neck, Long Island... Andy turns to a primitive 16mm PROJECTOR and turns it on. WHIR!  He smiles at the flickering light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yes.  I remember it well... We PUSH INTO the white light.  It fills our frame, blazing whiter, whiter...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. KAUFMAN HOUSE - 1957 - DAY A BLACK AND WHITE image slowly becomes COLOR.  Great Neck, 1957.  An upper-class Jewish neighborhood.  In the street, crewcut BOYS play t-ball, laughing and shouting.  A fat convertible pulls up to the smallest house, and STANLEY KAUFMAN, 40, gets out.  Still in his suit, he's a well- meaning slave to his job -- tired, responsible. Stanley goes over to admire the t-ball game.  At bat is his son MICHAEL, 6, a natural charmer.  Michael swings -- crack! -- and hits a solid single.  Stanley smiles.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: That's my boy!  Good swingin', kiddo. (warm beat; then a look) Hey -- Michael... where's your brother?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's inside. Instantly -- Stanley's mood turns black.  He frowns angrily, then snatches his briefcase and marches in. INT. KAUFMAN HOUSE, KITCHEN - 1957 - DAY Baby CAROL is crying.  Mom JANICE, 35, quickly peels carrots, trying to get dinner made.  Stanley marches past.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he in his room?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course he's in his room. (aggravated) All his "friends" are in there. Stanley glowers.  He huffs upstairs. INT. KAUFMAN HOUSE, HALLWAY - 1957 - DAY Stanley hurries up to Andy's shut door.  We hear little Andy doing VOICES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (as WORRIED GIRL) But professor, why are the monsters growing so big? (now as BRITISH PROFESSOR) It's something in the jungle water. I need to crack the secret code. Stanley rolls his eyes.  He opens the door... INT. KAUFMAN HOUSE, ANDY'S ROOM - 1957 - DAY ...revealing ANDY, 8, performing for the wall.  Andy is happy and enthusiastic... as long as he's acting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (as BRITISH PROFESSOR) Maybe I should talk to the natives. (as dancing NATIVES) Shoom boom boo ba!  Shoom boom boo ba -- STANLEY Andy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (startled) Oh! The boy suddenly turns off, becoming introverted... awkward. Frustrated, Stanley stares at his son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy, this has to stop.  Our house isn't a television station.  There is not a camera in that wall. Andy glances over at the wall.  Hmm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) (trying to cope) Son... listen to me.  It isn't healthy.  You should be outside, playing sports.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I've got a sports show. Championship wrestling, at five.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he blows his top) You know that's not what I meant! Look, I'm gonna put my foot down! No more playing alone.  You wanna perform, you GOTTA have an audience!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he points at the wall) B-but I have them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!  That is NOT an audience!  That is PLASTER!  An audience is people made of flesh!  They -- live and breathe!  Got it?! Andy thinks, considering his options.  Then, he nods.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. KAUFMAN HOUSE, FAMILY ROOM - 1957 - LATER THAT DAY Baby Carol sits in her crib.  Andy's hands suddenly YANK her out. INT. KAUFMAN HOUSE, ANDY'S ROOM - 1957 - DAY Andy hurries in and plops Carol down on the floor.  She dutifully sits there, deadpan. Andy returns to the center of the room.  He resumes his show.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (as KIDDIE SHOW HOST) And now, boys and girls!  It's time for... TV Fun House! (he makes an
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) Hi, everybody!  Are you ready for a singalong?  I'll say the animal, and you make his sound!  Okay...?  Okay! (he starts to SING) "Oh, the cow goes........." Carol stares, unblinking.  Then -- CAROL Moo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he smiles, pleased) "And the dog goes......"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "And the cat says......"
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. NY NIGHTCLUB - 1975 - NIGHT TIGHT on ANDY, now GROWN UP.  26-years-old, still performing the song.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: !! WIDE - It's a small, hip New York nightclub.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "And the bird says..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "And the lion goes..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "And that's the way it goes!" (he grins) Thank you.  Goodbye! Andy waves and bows.  There's faint scattered applause. Andy sighs.  An irritated MANAGER steps onstage.  He shoots Andy a disgruntled look, then takes the mike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The comedy stylings of Andy Kaufman, Ladies and Gentlemen! In the b.g., Andy starts packing up his props: Hand puppets, conga drums, a phonograph... it all goes into a big bulky case.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. NY NIGHTCLUB - 1975 - LATER THAT NIGHT The club is empty.  At the bar, the manager cleans up.  Andy eagerly comes over.  Offstage, his presence is soft, placid -- his voice barely above a whisper.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: So, Mr. Besserman, same slot tomorrow...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (awkward) Eh, I dunno... Andy.  I'm... thinkin' of letting you go...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're firing me?? (beat) You don't even pay me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look -- I don't wanna seem insulting.  But... your act is like amateur hour: Singalongs... puppets... playing records... A stunned beat.  Andy is hurt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want?  "Take my wife, please"??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure!  Comedy!  Make jokes about the traffic.  Do impressions.  Maybe a little blue material...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't swear.  I -- I don't do what everyone else does!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, everyone else gets this place cookin'!  Pal, it's hard for me to move the booze when you're singin' "Pop Goes The Weasel." Andy stares, disheartened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I'm sorry.  You're finished here. An uncomfortable beat -- and then Andy starts crying. The manager is dumbfounded.  He doesn't know what to do. Tears are rolling pitifully down Andy's cheeks.  The manager is confused -- totally disoriented.  Shamed, Andy covers his face, then runs out.  Silence.  The manager stares after him... having no idea what just happened. EXT. NY NIGHTCLUB - 1975 - NIGHT Sobbing Andy bursts out the door.  He steps onto the sidewalk -- and IMMEDIATELY STOPS CRYING.  Just like that. Andy lifts his big case and starts walking.  Andy shakes his head angrily. He turns down a dark street, hurrying alone through an unsavory New York neighborhood.  But then... TWO MEN appear... silently approaching.  Andy stops uncertainly -- debating whether to turn around.  But in that second -- the thugs are upon him, glaring menacingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #1 Give us your wallet. Andy stares fearfully.  An anxious moment.  He thinks... considering his options. Then, he suddenly stammers in a thick FOREIGN ACCENT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I -- doo not unterstand!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #1 Give us your money!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What??  What mooney?  Abu daboo!  I do not have mooney! The thugs glance at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Pleaze!  I just move to America yezterday!  I do not know!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #1 What's in the case?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NO!  Eeet, eet is just perzonal trifles from my homeland -- THUG #2 Shut up!  Gimme that thing! The guy snatches the case.  He impulsively BREAKS the lock... and clothes, congas and records fall out. The thugs are dismayed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #1 Goddamn immigrants!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #2 This guy's pathetic.  Let's go. Harsh glances.  They angrily turn and leave. Andy takes a nervous breath, then starts picking his things off the street.  He shouts after the guys:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tank you veddy much...!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. NY IMPROV - 1975 - NIGHT The Improv, the biggest comedy club around.  People are lined up, waiting.  The man strides up -- GEORGE SHAPIRO, a Hollywood talent manager.  George is old school: Bronx accent, shmooze and a hug... but with a surprising sweetness that is quite disarming.  A DOORMAN sees him, grins, and waves George in. INT. NY IMPROV, BAR - 1975 - NIGHT The bar is packed with COMICS and SHOW BIZ TYPES.  A few turn and smile -- "George!"  "Hey, George!"  George takes a couple hands, whispers to someone else, then drifts into the... INT. NY IMPROV, SHOWROOM - 1975 - NIGHT Where the show's in progress.  Owner BUDD FRIEDMAN sees George and gives him a bear-hug.  Then he hustles George to a table. George sits -- and gives the stage his undivided attention. Up there is a WISEASS COMIC.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: So I'm getting my mother-in-law a special Christmas present: A pre- paid funeral!  The mortician asked me if I wanted her buried, embalmed or cremated.  I said, "Make it all three!  I'm not takin' any chances!" (the crowd LAUGHS) Thank you.  Good night! The comic waves and exits.  APPLAUSE.  George politely claps.  A PIANO PLAYER jumps in with an upbeat show tune. We think there's a break... when Andy suddenly, awkwardly steps on stage.  He is in character as Foreign Man.  Pink jacket, tie, hair slicked back, frightened like a deer in headlights.  He puts down his big case, pulls out various junk, and arranges it on chairs. The room hushes, uncertain as to who the hell this guy is. Andy tentatively grabs the mike.  The stagefright is agony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now?  Now...? (looking around) Tank you veddy much.  I am very happy to be here.  I tink -- this is a very beautiful place.  But one ting I do not like is too much traffic.  Tonight I had to come from, eh, and the freeway, it was so much traffic.  It took me an hour and a half to get here! Andy chuckles, as if this were a punchline. Silence.  The crowd is baffled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) But -- talking about the terrible things: My wife.  Take my wife, please take her. Yikes.  A few NERVOUS LAUGHS. Andy gestures, as if they got the joke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) No really, I am only foolink.  I love my wife very much.  But she don't know how to cook.  You know, one time, she make a steak and mashed potato.  Ehh, and the night before, she make spaghetti and meatballs.  Her cooking is so bad... is terrible. People are embarrassed.  Some avert their eyes.  A couple hipsters laugh mockingly. George leans forward.  Andy wipes the sweat from his brow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right now, I would like to do for you some imitations.  So first, I would like to imitate Archie Bunker. (no change in his voice) "You stupid, everybody ees stupid! Ehh, get, get out of my chair Meathead... go in the, eh, Dingbat get into the kitchen, making the food!  Ehh, everybody ees stupid!  I don't like nobody, ees so stupid!" Tank you veddy much. (pleased, he proudly bows) Now I would like to imitate Jimmy Carter, the President of the United States. (no change in his voice) "Hello, I am Jimmy Carter, the President of the United States." Some people BOO and walk out.  A few giggle, getting into the groove. George is intrigued.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) And now... I would like to imitate the Elvis Presley. A woman LAUGHS caustically.  Andy grins stupidly, then turns his back to us.  He presses "Play" on a CASSETTE RECORDER... and the THEME FROM 2001 starts playing. House lights dim dramatically.  With a flourish, Andy pulls tape off his pants -- revealing rhinestones.  He removes his pink coat -- putting on a white jeweled jacket. He combs his hair. Then he brushes his hair. Then he combs his hair some more. Finally he picks up a guitar, strikes a pose -- and spins around. He is ELVIS.  CONFIDENT.  SEXY.  LIP CURL.  DEAD-ON PERFECT. The crowd is blown away. Vegas Elvis INTRO MUSIC suddenly blasts.  Andy/Elvis swaggers stage left and takes a bow.  Then he goes stage right and takes a bow.  Then he returns stage left for another bow. Music STOPS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you very much. Wow.  Flabbergasted, people APPLAUD.  This man is Elvis. Suddenly -- "JAILHOUSE ROCK" guitar kicks in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) (SINGING) "Warden threw a party In the county jail! Prison band was there And they BEGAN to WAIL!" ANGLE - GEORGE He is astonished.  George cannot quite figure out what's going on... but he wants in. He waves Budd over.  Budd leans down, and George WHISPERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pst.  What's the story with this guy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think he's Lithuanian.  None of us can understand him. George nods admiringly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He does a hell of an Elvis.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. NY IMPROV, BACKSTAGE - 1975 - LATER THAT NIGHT Andy is packing up his things.  He very methodically folds each item of clothing, then checks the creases. George strolls up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Hey, I really enjoyed your set.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tank you veddy much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I understand you're from Lithuania?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  Caspiar. George is puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Caspiar?  I haven't heard of that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a veddy small island in de Caspian Sea. (beat) It sunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.  Hm.  I'm uh, sorry. (beat) Well, look, I'm probably out of my mind -- but I think you're very interesting.  If you ever need representation... we should talk. George hands him a BUSINESS CARD.  Andy reads it -- then his eyes pop.  He DROPS the accent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Shapiro, it's an honor!! George realizes it's all been an act.  He laughs heartily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Caspiar, huh?!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. SOHO HEALTH FOOD RESTAURANT - NIGHT A Bohemian health food restaurant, staffed by hippie waitresses in sandals.  Andy and George sit together, trying to get a sense of each other.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: You see, I want to be the biggest star in the world. George is surprised at this hubris.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People love... comedians.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not a comedian.  I have no talent. (he shrugs) I'm a song-and-dance man. George looks up at Andy -- and inexplicably there is a giant MOIST BOOGER hanging from Andy's nostril. George cringes.  He doesn't know what to say. A waitress brings over two plates of awful 70's HEALTH FOOD -- seaweed, beans, stringy paste.  George frowns.  Andy beams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Mmm!  I particularly recommend the Lotus root. Andy pulls out a little Handi-wipe and cleanses his hands. Then he starts arranging the food in compulsive little piles: Beans in pinwheel shapes.  Sprouts in piles. George peers at the bizarre food behavior.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You show a lot of promise... but... my concern is I don't know where to book you.  You're not a stand-up... your act doesn't exactly translate to films... help me... where do you see yourself?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (bright) I've always wanted to play Carnegie Hall. George is unsure if that's a joke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, ha-ha.  That's funny. Andy dips his silverware in the water glass.  Two dunks, then he dries it with his napkin. George stares, perplexed.  He looks back up -- and Andy's booger has suddenly switched nostrils. Huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, I don't want easy laughs. Andy's about to eat -- but first bows his head in silent prayer.  George raises an eyebrow.  Andy snaps his head back up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I want gut reactions!  I want that audience to go through an experience.  They love me!  They hate me!  They walk out -- it's all
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Andy triumphantly eats a bean.  George peers, unable to take the booger anymore.  He hands Andy a napkin and points to his nose.  Andy nods, removes the rubber booger, and carefully puts it in a little box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) After I'm famous, I can sell these as "Worn by Andy Kaufman." And at that... George is won over.  He smiles broadly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're insane. (then sincere) But -- you might also be brilliant. Alright, Andy... let's do it. George warmly extends his hand. Andy slowly smiles, then takes George's hand.  The men shake.  A moment of supreme importance. EST. BEVERLY HILLS - DAY The glitz strip of Los Angeles.  Money.  Beauty. INT. SHAPIRO/WEST - DAY Real working showbiz offices.  No glamour at all.  It looks more like an insurance agency. George sits in his office, reassuring someone on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sammy, opening for David Brenner is a fine gig.  You'll be on the road... get some exposure... O.S., a SECRETARY shouts out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Tony Clifton on the phone!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) He says he's an associate of Andy Kaufman's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. (back to the phone) Sammy, think about it.  I gotta go. (he punches a line) Hello?  George Shapiro here. On the phone, a STACCATO, ABRASIVE NASAL VOICE blares.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Uh, yeah.  Is this GEORGE SHAPIRO?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat) Er, yes.  Speaking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) "Speaking"!  Reeking, seeking, creaking... Freaking! George is baffled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I help you with something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Yeah!  You stay away from that Andy Kaufman, if you know what's good for you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (stunned) Who is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) You -- you know damn straight who it is.  Tony Clifton!  A name to respect.  A name to fear. (beat) Beer.  Gear.  Deer.  Ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look... I don't know what your problem is...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Kaufman's a lying bastard!  If you sign him, I'll RUIN YOU! CLICK.  Clifton hangs up.  George is bewildered. INT. MEDITATION INSTITUTE UNIVERSITY, CLASSROOM - DAY The light is magical.  Soothing SITAR music plays.  Andy and fifteen other BAREFOOT STUDENTS sit on mats in a semi- circle.  Eyes shut, bodies in different yoga positions, they are all meditating. Facing them on a throne-like chair sits a reverent, Indian YOGI.  At his feet is the class teacher, LITTLE WENDY, a teeny lady with an absurdly high-pitched voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, while continuing your deep breathing, slowly open your eyes. You should feel rested, relaxed, and alert. The students all open their eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do any thoughts come...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #1 My mind is clear.  I feel great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #2 All the tension is gone from my body. The Yogi's eyes go to Andy.  Andy smiles sweetly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to thank you, your Holiness. My heart is radiating with pure energy. The Yogi nods kindly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You always had a good heart.  But I'm proud of the progress you've made in your discipline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  TM got me focused.  In fact, my manager got me a TV gig!  It's just some new show with no budget, but I'm still excited. Oh.  The Yogi peers intently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you at peace with your family?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um, yes.  I haven't fought with them, since I started here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goals are important.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I stopped drinking.  I gave up drugs.  And I'm meditating three hours a day.  It's the center of my life...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are all impressed. Andy smiles beatifically.  This means a lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.  Anyone else --?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, wait!  I have a question. (beat; working up his nerve) Is there... is there a secret to being funny? Huh?  The Yogi thinks hard... squinching up his face. Then... he finally speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  Silence.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. SNL SET - NIGHT An AUDIENCE sits, waiting for the commercial to end. TECHIES tweak lights.  CAMERAMEN get ready. Sitting in VIP seats are Andy's FAMILY.  Stanley and Janice are in their late 50's, Michael and Carol in their 20's. They're all anxious.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: I still can't believe my brother's gonna be on TV...!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope he doesn't get nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the difference?  This thing's on in the middle of the night -- no one's even gonna see it. The commercial ends, and the "APPLAUSE" sign blinks.  The crowd APPLAUDS.  An "ON THE AIR" sign lights up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Welcome back to Saturday Night Live! And now, as a special treat on our first show... musical guest ANDY KAUFMAN!!! The SNL orchestra starts the intro into a song.  Andy enters the stage with a boom box, and positions himself in front of the microphone.  When the vocals are supposed to start, Andy doesn't open his mouth.  Instead he looks around -- frightened.  The band stops... and starts again.  Andy remains mute.  The Band stops again. INT. SNL SET, BOOTH - NIGHT The SNL producer, LORNE MICHAELS, looks worried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's happening to him? INT. SNL SET - NIGHT At that moment, Andy puts the boom box down and blares it loudly.  The THEME FROM "MIGHTY MOUSE" plays -- but Andy just blankly stands there. He's purposefully doing nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) "Although we are in danger, We never despair, Because we know where there is danger He is there!" The audience is puzzled.  The Kaufmans are alarmed. INT. SNL SET, BOOTH - NIGHT Lorne Michaels is panicked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God, he's doing nothing.  It's dead air...! INT. SNL SET - NIGHT BACK ON ANDY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) "We're not worrying at all. We're just listening for his call..." Then SUDDENLY -- Andy comes to life and triumphantly LIP SYNCS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (cont'd) "Here I come to save the day!" Shocked, the crowd HOWLS with LAUGHTER. Then instantly -- Andy resumes his blank expression.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (cont'd) "That means that Mighty Mouse is on the way!" The audience SCREAMS with glee.  The tune ENDS, and the audience APPLAUDS CRAZILY. Delighted, Andy grins and bows. The Kaufmans clap the hardest.  Stanley locks eyes with Andy... and the beaming father smiles the proudest of all.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. SHAPIRO/WEST - DAY George jumps from his desk.  Andy is walking in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Andy, c'mon IN!  Thanks for flyin' out here!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The stewardess let me keep my headphones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's... terrific!  But I got something better.  This is BIG... (giddy; milking the moment) You are getting a once-in-a- lifetime, unbelievably lucrative opportunity to star on... a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!!! Andy's smile drops.  He freezes up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sitcom...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And this is a CLASS ACT!  It's the guys who did the Mary Tyler Moore and Bob Newhart shows!  It takes place in a taxi stand!  And you're gonna be the Fonzie!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (confused) I'm -- Fonzie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  The Fonzie!  The crazy breakout character!  The guy that all the kids impersonate and put on their lunchboxes!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (soft) George, I hate sitcoms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: you ain't heard the best part!  ABC has seen your foreign man character, and they want to turn him into -- (he checks his notes) "Latka," a lovable, goofy mechanic!!! Long pause.  Then -- Andy responds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "No"?  "No" to which part??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No to the whole thing.  None of it sounds good. George is flummoxed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy... this is every comedian's dream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you, I'm not a comedian.  And sitcoms are the lowest form of entertainment: Stupid jokes and canned laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shocked) B-but, this is classy... they did Bob Newha--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not interested.  I want to create my own material. Beat.  George glares.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I refuse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he explodes)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: you arrogant putz!  I've been in this business for twenty years!  I know!  If you walk away from this opportunity, you will never, NEVER see another one like it again!!!! Long pause.  Andy stares at George, amazed at this passion. Then Andy gets up and looks around the office.  He stares at the awards... the gold records... emblems of success and experience. Andy thinks -- then nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.  Fine, I'll do it. (beat) But I have a few terms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (relieved) Of course!  That's what negotiations are for. Andy starts to write on a piece of paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Writing down my terms. George watches patiently. Andy clicks his pen, done.  George smiles and takes the list.  He scans it... then his face gets totally befuddled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you makin' fun of me --?  This is RIDICULOUS!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (blas) Those are my terms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're IMPOSSIBLE!!  Jesus! (he points at one item) I mean -- "two guaranteed guest shots for Tony Clifton"??!  Who is this TONY CLIFTON?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a Vegas entertainer.  I used to do impressions of him.  We sorta... got in a fight over that. George gets a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This Clifton called me up.  He's a loon!  He HATES you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nah, he just talks tough.  But I owe him one. Andy smiles ingenuously, then turns stern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) If I'm the new Fonz... ABC's just gonna have to give me what I want. (a sarcastic FONZIE IMPRESSION) Heyyyyyy! George winces.  He stares at the list. INT. ABC CONFERENCE ROOM - LA - DAY George sits across a conference table from three NETWORK SUITS.  He stoically reads the men his demands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Kaufman will only appear in half the episodes. (beat) Mr. Kaufman requires an undisturbed
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: minutes of meditation prior to filming. (beat) Mr. Kaufman won't rehearse. (beat) Mr. Kaufman gets his own network Special. The execs are stupefied.  Finally -- George delivers the clincher.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) And Taxi must guarantee two guest appearances to... Tony Clifton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tony Clifton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #1 Who is he?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (solemn) I don't know. Long pause.  The execs stare at George like he's lost his mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) But Andy says he's fabulous. (awkward) He also says, these are the terms. The execs' leader, MAYNARD SMITH, shudders hopelessly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Couldn't Kaufman ask for more money, like everyone else? George slowly, sadly shakes his head:  No. Maynard glances at his team -- then frowns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) George, we don't book phantom performers.  The deal's off. INT. SHAPIRO/WEST - DAY GEORGE throws his attach case on the desk, then slumps into his chair.  He picks up the phone and dials.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Hi George!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eh, hi, Andy.  Look, this Tony Clifton... is he performing anywhere?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Of course. (beat) But only on Monday nights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's alright.  Where...? INT. MAMA ROMA'S - NIGHT Mama Roma's, a dark Italian restaurant with red booths, wise guys, and cigarette smoke. The Maitre'd guides George to a booth.  A small BAND fills the "stage" -- a six-foot space in the back of the room. The lights dim.  A BLARING ANNOUNCER speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) And now, Mama Roma's is proud to present International Singing Sensation... a man who has sold more records than Elvis and the Beatles combined... George is skeptical.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (cont'd) Ladies and Gentlemen, Mr. Entertainment... TONY CLIFTON! The DRUMMER starts a drum roll.  Patrons APPLAUD.  A LIGHT SPOT hits the entrance area... and nobody enters.  The spot is waiting... waiting... still waiting... until the drum roll slows down and stops.  The announcer BOOMS again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ladies and Gentlemen, out of respect for Mr. Clifton's vocal demands, could everyone please extinguish your cigarettes and cigars. The crowd GRUMBLES angrily -- then irritably complies.  One ANGRY GUY thrusts his cigar into a water glass.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (cont'd)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Goddamn, I paid five dollars for this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) And now!  A man who needs no introduction... TONY CLIFTON! The band starts playing lounge standard "VOLARE".  And then, obnoxious TONY CLIFTON swaggers out.  Tony has a rubbery face, black wig and moustache, sunglasses, a padded belly, and a peach tuxedo with blue shirt and velvet piping. Tony stops, smirks at the audience, and sucks on a cigarette.  He blows smoke rings at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heh-heh.  How ya all doin'? The crowd is furious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck you! People light back up and start talking.  Tony ignores the ruckus.  He starts SINGING, pinched and off-key.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (singing) "Volare! Whoa, whoa. Cantare, Whoa whoa whoa whoa." George winces.  He's horrible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) (singing)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: got the wings of your love, I got the wings of a dove. I got the... uh... (forgetting the words) ... the chicken wings from Eh, Kentucky Fried..." The band is lost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Oh.  Whoop do doo, Whoop de di, Stick a needle in your eye... The band gives up and stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eh, the hell with that song. One person CLAPS.  Most BOO.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) So how ya doin'! (leering) How ya doin' over here?  How ya doin' over there? (he approaches a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) How's that pasta carbonara?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave me alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay! (he spins around) So, you havin' a good time, sir?! Tony approaches a LONELY SAD SACK sitting at the bar.  Tony thrusts his mike at the guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he reacts as if this is enormously funny) "Bob"?  BOB!  Bob bob bob. (beat) Bob what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob Gorsky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Gorsky"?  What is that, Polish?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (meek) Yes. Tony gets indignant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you tryin' to do some of that Polack humor?  Well if that's so, you can just get the hell out of this restaurant!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (timid) It's my name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  I hate them Polish jokes! People are embarrassed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I do a clean show!  Like, I wouldn't do that one... oh, you know it... "What do you call a pretty girl in Poland"?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he giggles stupidly)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a tourist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, that's EXACTLY what I'm talkin' about! (enraged) Here!  I'LL give you a little humor! Tony snatches Bob's water glass and POURS IT over his head! George is appalled.  The crowd is aghast.  Bob is wet. People BOO AND HURL THINGS. Bob starts weeping, then bolts up and runs from the building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) And stay out, Fatso! The room erupts, outraged.  George covers his face, looking ill.  Suddenly, Tony snaps at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And YOU.  I wanna see you backstage! George is rattled. INT. MAMA ROMA'S, KITCHEN - LATER THAT NIGHT The kitchen staff is working.  George wanders around... then finally spots Tony, back to us, eating pasta at the employees' table.  Aggravated, George aggressively steps up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright, I'm here.  What do you want? Tony puts down his fork.  He pauses... slowly turns around... and is Andy. George GASPS.  His eyes bulge. Andy smiles innocently.  He gestures to an empty seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you hungry? George is breathing heavily, like someone about to have a heart attack.  His brain melting, he shakily reaches for a chair and sits.  George glances down.  Lying alongside the food is Tony's rubber face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I-I don't understand this act.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in jolly spirits) It's good old-fashioned entertainment.  Everyone loves a villain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?  Well tell that to the poor schlub who you humiliated! Beat -- then Bob strolls over.  His real name is BOB ZMUDA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Andy, good show.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh George, this is Bob Zmuda.  Bob and I have been buddies for years. George gapes.  On closer inspection, Bob is cocky, aloof, and conniving.  He and Andy grin naughtily at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was a really hot house!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So your name's not Gorsky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't believe everything you hear. George thinks about this -- then laughs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. ABC CONFERENCE ROOM - LA - DAY Maynard and the ABC suits sit at the table, mesmerized. George is confidentially whispering to them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: This has to stay in the room... but here's the thing: Andy is Tony.  And Tony is Andy!  They'll deny it up and down, but I swear to God, they're the same person! (with urgency) It's smart business!  You'll get two Andy Kaufmans for the price of one! Maynard thinks about this, quite methodically.  A beat, and then he cracks a smile... INT. ALPHA BETA SUPERMARKET - NIGHT 1 a.m. in the supermarket.  Just a few people linger... including Andy, who's at the Space Invaders videogame.  Andy stares intently at the screen, eyes piercing, fingers hammering the buttons while he blows up Martians.  Andy is oblivious to all around him. In the b.g., George suddenly enters.  He looks around the market, then spots Andy.  He feverishly runs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (still playing the game) What's up? George grins crazily, ecstatically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy... THEY SAID YES!  They agreed to it all!  They thought your terms were a shining example of your "irreverent wit" -- and precisely why they want you! (beat) You're getting EVERYTHING! Whoa.  Andy looks up, astonished.  His space station EXPLODES, but he doesn't notice.  He turns to George... and slowly smiles sweetly.  Genuinely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well thank you very much...!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. TAXI SET - DAY The first week of "TAXI."  The CAST rehearses on the Taxi set.  PRODUCERS watch from the bleachers. (The actual TAXI scene will be determined.)  JUDD HIRSCH, TONY DANZA, and MARILU HENNER read their lines. Then... a bored BLACK STAND-IN reads Latka's line. The cast glances around.  Tony Danza loses his temper.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Man, this is bullshit! (he marches up to the PRODUCER) Where's Kaufman?  Why isn't he here?? One producer stands.  This is tightly-wound ED WEINBERGER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll see him on Friday when we shoot.  Now run the lines with Rodney. An angry beat.  The actors resume... INT. TAXI SET - DAYS LATER The AUDIENCE is filtering in.  They fill the studio bleachers. INT. TAXI SET, BACKSTAGE - DAY Actors mingle outside the dressing rooms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm taking bets we do the show with the stand-in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I hear Andy arrived.  Rumor is he's locked inside his dressing room. Judd is surprised. INT. TAXI SET, ANDY'S DRESSING ROOM - DAY Andy is meditating.  He's tranquil, at total inner peace. Silence -- until a little clock radio CHIRPS. Andy snaps his eyes open.  He exhales a few calm breaths, then sits upright.  Andy reaches for a sealed envelope, rips it open, and removes a SCRIPT. Andy sighs, opens the script, and starts scanning the pages like a speedreader. INT. TAXI SET - LATER THAT DAY Bleachers are full.  They're now filming TAXI (the same scene as earlier).  On cue, Andy enters as LATKA -- wide- eyed, endearing, in mechanic's overalls. Andy is hilarious.  The crowd HOWLS with laughter. MONTAGE - TAXI In quick succession, a series of Andy's best Latka moments. He's beloved.  The applause grows louder, louder, LOUDER... INT. TAXI SET, BACKSTAGE - DAY TAXI curtain calls.  The whole cast takes bows, then runs offstage.  Everyone is grinning -- except Andy. He soberly strolls up to Zmuda.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna quit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?!?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Each show is worse than the next.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you nuts?!  40 million people watch you every week!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So?  What do they know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely nothing!  That's the beauty! (he lowers his voice) It's credibility.  You make them love you... and then later, on your special, you'll screw with their heads! Hmm?!  Andy raises an eyebrow.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. MAYNARD SMITH'S OFFICE - LA - DAY The power office of Maynard Smith, the powerful ABC exec. He shouts into a phone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: I don't care!  Travolta signed a contract, he's a Sweathog for life!... Oh yeah?  Just try to sue us. He HANGS up.  His ASSISTANT peeks her head in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, they're having a problem down on the Kaufman Special.  They say he's not following the... technical requirements. Maynard is baffled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Technical"??? INT. "KAUFMAN SPECIAL" SET, TECH BOOTH - SAME TIME Andy is in a booth, arguing with a HEAVYSET TECHNICIAN. Zmuda watches and eats a banana.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's my show!  Now make it roll!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Maynard strolls up, buttoning his suit jacket, irritated as he walks around Little Wendy meditating in front of a ring of candles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy, I hear fabulous things about the Special... (a delicate pause) Eh, I understand we've hit a teeny speedbump?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (harried) Yeah, Kid Genius told me to mess with the horizontal hold!  He wants the picture to roll! Maynard doesn't exactly understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Show me. The technician pushes a button.  ON THE MONITOR - Andy's image briefly appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now... in her television debut, the incredible Chubby Rosalie!! At that moment, Andy's image starts rolling across the screen, until it disappears into a blur of static...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (happy) It'll be great.  The viewer will think their TV is broken.  They'll get out of their chair, they'll twist the knobs, they'll hit the TV, but they won't be able to fix it! Maynard stares at the monitor.  The totally indecipherable picture still rolls.  A glum pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy... we don't want the viewer to get out of their chair.  They might change the channel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it's funny!  It's a practical joke.  They'll get frustrated! Andy beams giddily.  Maynard gazes dully, struggling to reason.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy... uhh... this network has a long-standing policy: The viewer must be able to see the program.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it's only for thirty seconds! Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Five.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenty!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ten.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deal. Both men quickly extend their hands and shake.  Maynard nods and leaves. Beat.  Then, Andy pulls out a Handi-wipe and cleans his palm. A STUDIO PAGE walks over.  He has a huge MAIL BAG.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Kaufman, do you want your mail? Andy looks up -- and his face lights up like Christmas. INT. ANDY'S APARTMENT - DAY Andy's crappy apartment, which looks like a dorm room: Cheap furniture, stained carpet, and a framed photo of the Maharishi.  Andy lies on his bed, which is covered with THOUSANDS OF LETTERS.  He happily chats on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Yes, it's Andy Kaufman!... Really! ...I got your fan letter... So you like the show?  Your letter said I was silly.  Did you think I was too silly?... Oh good.  I'm glad. Andy holds a letter which has a GIRL'S SNAPSHOT stapled to it.  He is very nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) It was real nice of you to send your picture, Mimi... 'Cause you knew what I looked like... and now, I know what you look like! Andy flips the letter over.  He glances at the return address.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) So, um... San Bernardino... (beat) That's just a couple hours away, isn't it...? EXT. SAN BERNARDINO, DOWNTOWN - DUSK The sun is setting.  In an ugly shopping district, Andy walks along with sexy, wholesome MIMI.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... so after I finish junior college, I'll go to work for my dad's accounting firm.  Unless, I decide to live with my friend Valerie, but she wants to move to Anaheim, and I don't want to do that. A disinterested beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Another beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) So do you wanna wrestle?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me -- ? ANDY Do you wanna wrestle?  It's a good way of breaking the ice. (pause) That instant physical intimacy really brings two people together. Mimi is bewildered, and offended.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about?!  We just met an hour ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calm) No no no, it's not sex!  I mean -- it can lead to sex... but really, it's just wrestling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't wanna talk about it! An awkward silence.  They continue walking.  She points up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) The sunset is really beautiful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a bit offput) I mean -- uh -- the colors in the sky are so vibrant.  I love this time of day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he shrugs dully) I've never understood that.  It's just... getting dark. (pause) But I like you!  Hey!  Why don't we fill the car with gas, drive to Tijuana, and GET MARRIED??? ANGLE - MIMI Fear.  She shivers, then hoarsely speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I wanna go home.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. ABC CONFERENCE ROOM - LA - DAY George screens Andy's TV Special for Maynard and his team. The network execs look constipated. ON THE TV - Andy speaks tenderly, lovingly to Howdy Doody.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: You know... I was once in your gallery.  I was just sitting there and I wanted to touch you.  I was kind of depressed because I could see what everyone was like, and I was wondering if, now, maybe I could... touch you. Very gently, Andy touches Howdy's cheek and starts weeping. THE EXECS -- are horrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Howdy, I've been watching you ever since I was a little boy... (choked up, nervous) You're the first friend from television I ever had.  I always wanted to meet you... and now ...I finally am.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: #2 This is NOT funny.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: #3 (ominous) "Artsy Fartsy shit"...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (worried at this response) No... eh, the Special isn't all like this... just wait... it will be hysterical. At that moment, the picture turns to FUZZY SNOW.  Maynard scowls.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Christ!  We're the Number One Network -- can't we afford decent TVs?! Maynard angrily jumps and POUNDS on the TV.  BANG, BANG! George winces -- then mutters awkwardly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, um... it's part of the snow. An awful beat. Maynard is embarrassed.  Finally -- he explodes. MAYNARD Tell Kaufman we will NEVER air this program!! INT. JERRY'S DELI - NIGHT A delicatessen.  Andy wears an apron and angrily cleans tables.  He stacks dirty dishes and wipes up the food.  Two BLUE COLLAR GUYS gesture from a booth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, could I please have more coffee?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, yeah, in a sec'. (he lugs the dishes to the kitchen) That was decaf, right? The guy nods.  Andy hurries over with the coffeepot and starts pouring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, you look just like Andy Kaufman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I get that all the time. Andy hurries off.  The guy's buddy leans in, whispering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm telling you, it's him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanna bet??  If that was him, he wouldn't be workin' here, pouring my coffee! NEAR THE KITCHEN Andy dumps out wet coffee grounds.  He is sweating.  In the b.g., George enters the restaurant.  He sees Andy, sits at a table and YELLS OUT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey!  Could you clear this table and bring me a piece of poundcake? Andy turns.  They stare down each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Andy, this is ridiculous.  Take off that apron.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (infuriated)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  I'd rather work here, than at
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  There's no lying in a restaurant.  They don't promise you a job as a cashier, then suddenly make you a frycook! Andy hurries off with a water pitcher.  George chases him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I'm sorry.  They're assholes! But we work in a creative business. You can't predict what people are gonna like -- ANDY The ONLY reason I did Taxi was so I could have my own Special!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (trying to calm him) Tell you what.  I'll book you on some concerts, and meanwhile, we'll show the Special around... see if somebody wants to buy it -- ANDY (bitter) Yeah, we can have a garage sale. "Hey look, I got a floor lamp and a network TV Special for only fifty cents!" A glum moment. Andy fills water glasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) How long is left on my Taxi contract?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You signed for five years -- (awkward) So four years, seven months.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he looks up) Okay... I'll go back.  But just let them know, first they ain't gettin' Latka.  They're gettin' Tony!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. TEXAS A&M COLLEGE AUDITORIUM - NIGHT A marquee says "TEXAS A&M PRESENTS - ANDY KAUFMAN" Inside, a ROAR of APPLAUSE surges. INT. COLLEGE AUDITORIUM - SAME TIME Andy is walking onstage.  The excited CLAPPING swells.  He's a gigantic presence to these people. Andy smiles and bows.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Thank you.  It's great to be here. We're going to have a very nice time.  We'll sing some songs -- SORORITY GIRL DO LATKA!! Andy reacts, perturbed.  He struggles to stay composed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, we'll play with puppets -- DRUNKS IN UNISON LATKA!  LATTTTKAAAA!!! Andy scowls.  Then -- he loses it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me one moment. Andy angrily hurries offstage. INT. COLLEGE AUDITORIUM, BACKSTAGE - NIGHT Zmuda is with the congas and props.  Andy runs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me the book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (startled) No!  Andy, don't do it -- ANDY They're asking for it. Andy fiercely GRABS a small book from Zmuda.  Zmuda cringes. INT. COLLEGE AUDITORIUM - NIGHT Andy strides back out.  He gazes at the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Since you're such a special audience... I'm going to reveal, for the first time ever, the real me. (he goes into a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) I'm actually British.  I was raised in London and educated at Oxford. And though I dabble in clowning, I do find it so boorish.  So... American. (beat) I prefer the fine arts.  Henceforth, tonight,  I'd like to grace you with a reading of the greatest novel ever written! (he holds up the book) "The Great Gatsby", by F. Scott Fitzgerald!! BEAT. Heh?  The crowd isn't quite clear if this is good or bad.  A confused murmur.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he cracks open the book) Chapter One. (he starts READING) "In my younger and more vulnerable years, my father gave me some advice that I've been turning over in my mind ever since.  'Whenever you feel like criticizing anyone,' he told me, 'just remember that all the people in this world haven't had the advantages you've had.'" There's a little NERVOUS LAUGHTER.  Is he really gonna read this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) "He didn't say any more, but we've always been unusually communicative in a reserved way, and I understood that he meant a great deal more than that..." Suddenly, somebody from the audience screams:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!! The audience ROARS approvingly.  Andy stops reading and looks at the student.  He smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tank you veddy much!!!! The audience APPLAUDS enthusiastically.  Andy waits until the applause dies and goes back to the book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "When I came back from the East last autumn, I felt that I wanted the world to be in uniform and at a sort of moral attention forever; I wanted no more riotous excursions with privileged glimpses into the human heart..." People start BOOING.  Andy looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Please, let's keep it down.  We have a long way to go. (he resumes reading) "Only Gatsby, the man who gives his name to this book, was exempt from my reaction - Gatsby, who represented everything for which I have an unaffected scorn..." The crowd is incredulous. INT. COLLEGE AUDITORIUM - LATER THAT NIGHT ANDY (BRITISH) Chapter Two. The crowd is horribly bored. INT. COLLEGE AUDITORIUM, BACKSTAGE - NIGHT The clock says 11:30.  The PROMOTER glares at Zmuda.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he ever going to stop?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (dour) Sure.  When he reaches "The End." INT. COLLEGE AUDITORIUM - LATER THAT NIGHT People are streaming out.  Maybe fifty are left.  Andy realizes this -- but is committed.  He must continue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Tom was evidently perturbed at Daisy's running around alone, for on the following Saturday night he came with her to Gatsby's party.  Perhaps his presence gave the evening its peculiar quality of oppressiveness..." A weak VOICE feebly shouts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do Latka. Andy looks up, shocked.  Insulted, he "blows his temper."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look!  I don't have to tolerate this impoliteness!  Forget it -- I'm gonna stop the show.  GOODBYE! He slams the book shut.  People CHEER.  Andy starts to storm off -- then turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) No, no, I'm only fooling. The audience GROANS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I'll tell you what.  Would you rather have me continue reading or would you like to hear the phonograph record? The audience ROARS for the record.  Andy smiles, puts the needle on and to everyone's horror more "Gatsby" comes out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "His presence gave the evening its peculiar quality of oppressiveness - it stands out in my memory from Gatsby's other parties that summer..."
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. COLLEGE AUDITORIUM - LATER THAT NIGHT There are six people left in the audience.  Andy reads on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: "Tomorrow we will run faster, stretch out our arms farther... And one fine morning - So we beat on, boats against the current borne back ceaselessly into the past." Andy somberly shuts the book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) The End. A moment of quiet personal euphoria.  Andy looks enraptured, the man who has just climbed Everest. A pause -- but no applause.  It's dead silence.  Andy looks out... and realizes the few audience members are asleep. Andy shrugs, then shuffles off-stage. In the wings, Zmuda snores loudly in a folding chair. EXT. COLLEGE AUDITORIUM - DAWN Andy and Zmuda walk out, Zmuda squinting groggily.  They drag the suitcase containing the props.  They walk slowly towards their rental car, the campus totally deserted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody likes anarchy more than me... but this is science fiction! Andy nods uncomprehendingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's get some breakfast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kind of show was this??! (angrily reading off a LIST) There were three-hundred walkouts! The promoter wants a refund! Andy mumbles in a pipsqueak whimper.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. SHAPIRO/WEST - DAY George is yelling at Andy and Zmuda.  They are seated on his couch, heads bowed in shame.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, George...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're DAMN RIGHT you're sorry! (turning on Zmuda) And you -- you're the road manager! You should be watchin' out for him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a guilty sigh) We might have lost our focus... George paces furiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When you play the Midwest and South, you DON'T MINDFUCK THESE PEOPLE! It's not postmodern -- it's rude. (beat) If you wanna perform in Texas, you give 'em Mighty Mouse!  You give 'em Elvis!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But George, I like to push the boundaries...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's great.  But do it in LA and New York!  There you experiment! Show up with a sleeping bag and take a nap on stage!  I don't care! Hmm.  Andy thinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long would they let me sleep?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know! (he composes himself and lowers his voice to a hush) Andy... you need to look inside: Who are you trying to entertain?  The audience... or yourself? ANGLE - ANDY He doesn't know the answer.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. SHAPIRO/WEST, BATHROOM - DAY Andy is manically washing his hands.  Using liquid soap from the dispenser, then rubbing his hands under the water.  Then more liquid soap.  More rubbing.  Then more liquid soap... INT. SHAPIRO/WEST - DAY George sighs at Zmuda.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: I'm worried about Andy.  His stress level is affecting his work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he thinks) Isn't Tony Clifton going on Taxi soon?  Maybe that'll chill him out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob, Andy needs to RELAX.  See if you can get him away from all this. Take him to Hawaii, or Bali... Find something special.  Something nice... Zmuda mulls this over.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. MUSTANG RANCH, NEVADA - DAY A tattered sign says "Welcome to the MUSTANG RANCH."  The world-famous whorehouse sits behind a barb-wire fence. Dusty connected trailers sit in the sand. A CAR idles out front.  Zmuda and a scared Andy sit inside.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: I dunno about this... (worried) What will my mother think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She'll say, "Now my son is a man."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's so dirty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nah.  The girls sponge off between johns. Andy nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. INT. MUSTANG RANCH - DAY The reception room -- wood paneling and black-lite posters. Music is playing.  Twenty deadpan HOOKERS are lined up. Andy, nervous as a high school kid, points at one... then another... then the first...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which one? Beat -- then Andy becomes GERMAN, with a monocle and stiff walk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I vill haf both!  I vill haf dat fraulein... unt... the vun vith the big strudels! The two chosen girls take Andy's hands and lead him off.  He reaches the door -- then gives Zmuda a nervous look.  Zmuda smiles reassuringly.  Andy gulps, and goes in... Beat.  Zmuda turns to the older, jaded MADAM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a big day.  It's my friend's first time with a prostitute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (mocking) What're you talking about?  Andy comes here almost every weekend. Zmuda's jaw drops, stupefied.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're talking about... Andy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, he doesn't always call himself that.  Sometimes he's Tony, and wears a tux. Disbelief -- then Zmuda LAUGHS sharply.  He's been conned. INT. MUSTANG RANCH, BEDROOM - DAY Andy and the two hookers are WRESTLING.  They grapple and roll around, all three of them in their underwear. Suddenly Andy flips the girls over and pins them with his arms. Breathing hard, he stares down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You let me win.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (she giggles sexily) What if we did...?! Andy grins and leans down...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey.  If I give you three-hundred dollars, will you come to LA and help me destroy a TV show?
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. TAXI SET, REHEARSAL ROOM - DAY The Taxi cast sits irritably around a big table, holding scripts.  Ed Weinberger enters.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Where is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He just arrived.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's an hour late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I'm told this Clifton guy is a little eccentric.  You're all just gonna have to roll with the punches this week. Suddenly -- the door SLAMS open.  Tony bounds in, filthy drunk, clutching a bottle in a brown bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taxi!  Laxy!  Just the factsy, Maxie!  Them's all the words that rhyme with taxi!... Right, girls? Little Wendy and the Hooker sashay in, dressed as tarts. Tony feels them up, and they SQUEAL.  The cast stares in horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Eh, why the blue faces?  You musta read the script! (he chuckles) Well, don't worry!  Your pal Tony stayed up all night, writin' some fixes on it. (he pulls out some
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) I added me a musical number, cut out Judd Hirsch, and changed the location to Mardi Gras! Ed's expression goes ashen.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. TAXI SET - LATER THAT DAY An attempted rehearsal.  Tony is tap-dancing on top of a car hood.  He does a "fancy" move, and his booze bottle suddenly flies away and CRASHES against the wall. The cast watches, pissed and bored.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: And now, the new theme song! (he starts SINGING) "Oh yes, we drive a taxi, And we're havin' fun. Yeah, we work together, And we get the freakin' job done." INT. TAXI SET, TECH BOOTH - DAY Beleaguered Ed sits with George.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: George, we've lost two days. Filming is on Friday.  We HAVE to let him go!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (worried) I'm not sure how Andy's gonna take this...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So we'll go downstairs and tell him! He points at Tony, swaggering around on the set.  George shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But that's Tony down there.  That's not Andy.  Trust me, it's like "Sybil" -- Andy's nowhere on the premises! Ed glares.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well whoever the fuck that is, I'm firing him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he sighs) Okay.  But we'll have to warn Andy first.  I think he's up in San Francisco, doing a concert. Heh?  Ed raises his eyebrows.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. TAXI SET, TECH BOOTH - SECONDS LATER George is on the phone.  Ed hovers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Hi, Diane, this is George.  I'm trying to reach Andy up in San Francisco. (a stilted pause) Yeah, I'll wait. Ed glances down at the stage... and suddenly Tony is no longer there.  He's magically vanished. Beat. George turns on the SPEAKERPHONE, then CLICK!  Andy's happy voice pops on the line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Hi, George!  Good to hear from you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Andy.  How's the weather up there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Oh, you know the Bay Area!  Always foggy! Ed looks totally off-balance.  George winks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm here with Ed over at Taxi. There's been some trouble with Tony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Oh no!  Did he get hurt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no, Andy, nothing like that. (nervous beat) But... Tony's not fitting in.  His style of performance is too... burlesque.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. TAXI SET, ANDY'S DRESSING ROOM - DAY Tony is on the phone.  Little Wendy is busily refilling his whiskey bottle with canned ice tea.  He looks up, insulted.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: "Burlesque"?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ED Andy, I'm calling you up like this because I have the utmost respect for your artistry.  But -- I need your permission to fire him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. TAXI SET, TECH BOOTH - DAY
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Oh dear! (upset) George, this is gonna kill Tony. He's waited his whole life for this break.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There'll be other shots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy, I have to do it.  He's a terrible actor. Andy thinks about this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I guess I understand.  But Ed -- please... let him down gentle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Andy, I will. Andy hangs up.  A relieved Ed turns to George.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Thank you.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. TAXI SET - LATER THAT DAY Tony SCREAMS insanely.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: !  I AIN'T GOIN'!! WIDE Ed is stupefied.  The cast stands nervously behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We had a deal!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what yer talkin' about. You musta talked to someone else -- ED Yeah!!  I talked to Andy Kaufman!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know nothin' about no Kaufman.  He's been ridin' my coattails, smearing my reputation. Been usin' my good name, to get places. Ed is livid.  He gazes harshly at Tony -- Tony's burning eyes piercing through the rubber features.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get off my stage!  You're fired!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!  I'm gonna take you to the DEPARTMENT OF LABOR! Suddenly -- FLASH!  Ed looks over.  A REPORTER has a camera.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: TONY CLIFTON I GOT A CONTRACT

direction.raw_text: Who're YOU?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm from the LA Times.  We're doing a little puff piece on Mr. Clifton. (beat) Mr. Kaufman arranged it. UP IN THE BLEACHERS - George enters.  He looks down at the growing debacle, and winces.  Uh-oh. ONSTAGE - Enraged, Ed blows up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Security!  Escort this man off the lot!! ONSTAGE - Studio SECURITY GUARDS run over.  They GRAB Tony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop!  GETCHER HANDS OFF ME! Tony scuffles.  The camera FLASHES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  I'M A BIG STAR! IN THE BLEACHERS - George stares at this mess... and starts giggling. ONSTAGE - Two guards drag Tony to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) You'll be SORRY!  One day I'm gonna
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: this town!! Tony SCREAMS and gets removed.  Dead silence.  Then -- ED I don't want those pictures getting out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the reporter) This is a closed set.  You'll have to give me the film in that camera. The Guard reaches for the camera.  An uncertain moment... until Zmuda authoritatively cuts in, from out of nowhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll take care of this. Zmuda takes the camera.  He casually starts to make his way for the exit... when Ed suddenly HOLLERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait -- he's one of THEM! Zmuda gasps.  Two guards go running for him. Zmuda barrels away, trying to escape.  The guards chase. Zmuda races by George, and suddenly palms off the camera into George's arms.  The guards whip by, oblivious. George grimaces, unclear about his loyalties.  He sweatily peers at the timebomb in his hands. And then -- George thrusts it under his jacket.  He bolts for the door and feverishly scampers out. EXT. PARAMOUNT LOT - DAY George runs for his life.  He knocks aside a rack of costumes and serpentines between people. At the gate, Tony's being dragged, kicking and screaming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop!  HELP!  You wouldn't do this to Wayne Newton -- The guards toss Tony out the gate.  He lands in a heap. In the b.g., George crazily flies by.  He gets out the exit. EXT. PARAMOUNT LOT, OUTSIDE THE GATES - DAY George doubles over, trying to catch his breath.  He glances down... and Tony is lying next to him.  Little Wendy and Zmuda run up, out of breath. They all look at each other.  There's a moment of understanding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey.  Good hustlin'. George slowly smiles. INT. TAXI OFFICES - SAME TIME Ed storms in, insanely angry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That asshole!  That FUCKING BASTARD!! (he SLAMS the door behind him) We had a fuckin' deal, and THAT COCKSUCKER SHAFTED ME!! Ed is seething.  His SECRETARY timidly speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um, Ed... you have a phone call -- ED I'M NOT IN!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, um... it's Andy Kaufman... Heh??!  Shaking with fury, Ed stares at the telephone... then slowly picks it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah??? A long pause... then Andy's voice calmly speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) You were brilliant. A flabbergasted beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) You were in the moment.  You became a producer losing his mind. (sincerely joyful) It was the best improv I've ever seen. TIGHT - ED He thinks intently about this.  And then... amazingly, a magnificent smiles comes over his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well -- thank you. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Okay.  See you next week. Andy hangs up.  Ed just sits there, astounded.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. LA HEALTH FOOD RESTAURANT - NIGHT Andy, Zmuda, George and Little Wendy are squeezed in a booth, laughing and celebrating.  They eagerly read the LA Times. INSERT - The headline says "WHO IS TONY CLIFTON?"  Below is a PHOTO of Tony being thrown off the Taxi set. They all HOWL.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: This is great!  It makes Tony REAL - - three-dimensional!  It's very good for his career. Zmuda reads one paragraph.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Was this in actuality Andy Kaufman? And if it was Andy Kaufman, is Andy Kaufman crazy?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he chortles) Boy, they totally fell for it!  I'm only acting crazy! Hmm.  A few awkward glances. Then -- Andy grins at his meal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Boy, this is tasty. (he shouts to a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) Hey, can I please have some more seaweed?!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. BOOKER'S OFFICE - DAY A slick BOOKER, sitting in a crowded office full of head shots.  He's on the phone.  He's reading the LA Times story.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Mr. Shapiro, this is Gene Knight, up at Harrah's Tahoe.  We'd like to book Andy Kaufman for our showroom.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. SHAPIRO/WEST - DAY George on the phone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Ehh -- Andy doesn't really like playing casinos.  The audiences don't work well for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Oh. Disappointed beat.  The booker thinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (cont'd) What about Tony Clifton?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (startled) Really?!  You want Tony Clifton to headline Harrah's Tahoe??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (being tricky) Eh, sure.  We're trying to expand our audience base -- and I know the college kids really love Andy Kaufman. George winces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look -- I gotta be clear with you. Tony Clifton is NOT Andy Kaufman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Yeah, yeah, yeah.  I know! (he LAUGHS merrily) Wink wink!  Nudge nudge!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (frustrated) No, I'm serious.  If you book Tony, do NOT EXPECT TO GET ANDY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (LAUGHING harder) I'll take my chances!! George rolls his eyes in annoyance.  Finally, he shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine, be my guest!  Book him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. SUNSET BLVD - DAY George is driving in his convertible.  Suddenly, something catches his eye -- and in shock he HITS the brakes.  Three cars behind him SCREECH crazily, trying not to hit each other. George is oblivious.  He's staring up at a BILLBOARD. The BILLBOARD: It says "HARRAH'S TAHOE PRESENTS, ANDY KAUFMAN & TONY CLIFTON!  TOGETHER ON STAGE!  ONE NIGHT ONLY!" George is flabbergasted. EXT. SUNSET BLVD, PHONEBOOTH - DAY George is shouting into a payphone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Gene, you misunderstood!!  You're not getting BOTH of them! (upset) It's physically impossible!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Why's that?  You said over and over and over, Tony Clifton is not Andy Kaufman -- GEORGE Yeah, I KNOW what I said!  But -- trust me, it's not gonna happen!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Sure it is.  Tony called me himself. He yelled at me, insisting that his dressing room be bigger than Andy's. They're both going on tonight, believe me! George is stupefied.  He looks at his watch.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. LAKE TAHOE - DUSK Magnificent HARRAH'S dominates the skyline.  The marquee blares "TONY CLIFTON AND ANDY KAUFMAN!"  George screeches up in a rental car.  He jumps out and runs inside. INT. HARRAH'S SHOWROOM - NIGHT The showroom is packed.  It hums with curiosity.  WAITERS clean off the dinner tables.  George rushes in and is seated in a far booth, with some STRANGERS.  He overhears a heated conversation between a PUSHY MAN and his WIFE.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: You're not listenin'!  It's a VERY simple concept.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're making no sense.  How can they be the same person --?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trust me!  You'll never see them on stage at the same time! The onstage ORCHESTRA hits a fanfare.  LIGHTS DIM.  Sharp SPOTLIGHTS meet at the foot of the stage.  Suddenly -- Tony swaggers out, hands over his head in a gesture of triumph. Thunderous APPLAUSE.  Tony beams.  The music stops. George leans in, curious as to how Andy will wiggle out of this. Tony bows theatrically, turns back to face the orchestra, and waits.  The NOISE LEVEL slowly drops -- but not entirely.  Tony waits, and waits, and waits... until suddenly he turns towards the audience and SCREAMS FURIOUSLY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!!!!! Everybody looks up, alarmed.  The general murmur almost dies.  Tony stands there, eyes flashing with anger at all the unruly people.  As they quiet down... Tony turns back to the orchestra and raises his arms.  The MUSICIANS lift their instruments.  Silence is total -- except for the clank of china. Waiters are serving coffee.
