Tony spins back around, livid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!! People signal "shh"!  The waiters realize Tony's addressing them, and they stare back in disbelief!  This is their job!
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THAT APPLIES TO YOU, TOO, PENGUINS

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Yeah!  Yeah!  YOU!  I'm talkin' to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!  And you better freeze, or I'll get your asses fired!!! Tony's outburst is so commanding that they all freeze.  The waiters stand there like statues, staring in terror. Satisfied, Tony burns back to the orchestra and raises his arms.  Again, the musicians lift their instruments.  In anticipation of loud music, the waiters start moving about. Audience members start whispering.  Tony hears this -- and drops his arms and head in despair. The musicians lower their instruments.  Tony waits for absolute silence.  Only then does he signal the musicians to get ready again.  They do.  And then at that precise moment -- somebody DROPS a spoon. Tony jolts, as if hit by a current.  He drops his hands again, turns, and gives the perpetrator a murderous look. Then he turns again, lowers his head, and waits.  And waits. And waits. The man at George's table WHISPERS to his wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's never gonna start!  Kaufman thinks this is funny! (beat) We've paid forty bucks for a show that's never gonna start! George grins stupidly.  The silence is now deafening. Slowly, very slowly, Tony raises his arms.  Slowly... the musicians get their instruments ready.  Tony stands there, and stands, and stands, waiting for something... anything... to disturb the silence.  In vain.  Somebody COUGHS.  The whole scene repeats itself. Finally -- finally -- Tony is surrounded by total silence. Then, (only a moment before the length of this scene would become unbearable), he begins to move.  Tony pivots around, looks at the audience... And the entire room looks like Tussaud's Wax Museum.  Tony starts LAUGHING hysterically.  The audience's reaction is mixed: Some people LAUGH.  Some BOO.  Some ask perplexed questions. Some SCREAM OBSCENITIES.  Some even APPLAUD. Tony is very happy.  He turns to the orchestra, raises his baton -- and commences the downbeat!  The MUSIC BEGINS. A SPOTLIGHT hits the wings... and then ANDY STRIDES OUT. George's jaw drops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You see!  I told you!  They're not the same person! The whole audience BURSTS INTO APPLAUSE.  Life is back to normal.  Andy bows shyly and takes his place in front of a prepared row of congas.  He starts to play. Tony Clifton grabs the microphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you!  Thank you!  I wrote this tune for my friend Frank Sinatra. He had a nice little success with it... but forgot to thank me on the album. He starts to BELT "I Gotta Be Me". George squints his eyes, trying to figure out who this is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) "Whether I'm right Or whether I'm wrong Whether I find a place in this world Or never belong! I gotta be me!  I gotta be me! What else can I be, but what I am?" Tony's singing is awful.  Andy happily accompanies on congas.  The audience doesn't know what to think. Tony's SINGING reaches the end... aggressive and off-key.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Let's bring it on home -- (he hits his screeching CLIMAX)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !" The BAND ends with a brassy punch.  The crowd responds with LOUD BOOING.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. HARRAH'S, BACKSTAGE - LATER THAT NIGHT George wanders the corridor, looking for the dressing rooms. He turns and finds a door marked "KAUFMAN".  Next to it is a door marked "CLIFTON". George stares.  He thinks, then opens the "KAUFMAN" door. Andy is inside alone, gathering his things.  He's pleasantly surprised to see George. George doesn't enter.  He goes to the "CLIFTON" door.  Andy follows.  George opens the mystery door... INT. HARRAH'S, CLIFTON'S DRESSING ROOM - NIGHT and inside, taking off the rubber Tony makeup, is Zmuda. George starts hyperventilating.  Shaking, he tries to sit himself down.  Andy enters, beaming.  George is amazed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: You're so proud.  You're like some retarded kid comin' home from school: "Look, Dad, I got an F!"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But wasn't it funny?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Funny"?  I dunno.  But "intriguing"... "mindboggling"... perhaps "headache-inducing"... sure. (softening) Like, that moment, when you both came onstage... Andy excitedly jumps up and down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-huh!  See, with all these articles, people think they're insiders.  They see Tony Clifton, and they say, "Ah, that's really Andy Kaufman."  But that spoils it. So NOW, Tony denying being me is the truth!  Tony's not me!  But maybe he is!  The audience will never know... (giddy) They'll think they're laughin' at me
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: but actually I'll be laughin' at them, because they're wrong and I'm right! George is dazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you've got this big elaborate joke, which is really only funny to two people in the universe. (dry) You... and you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure!  But WE think it's kickass! Now I get to be Tony.  I get to dump the glass of water on someone else's head!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he turns serious) But what's the POINT?  How will any of this make you the biggest star in the world? Hmm.  Andy contemplates this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: George... I'm at a stage where the audience expects me to constantly shock them.  But short of faking my death, or setting the theater on fire, I don't know what else to do. (thoughtful) 'Cause I've always got to be one step ahead of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I feel you're extending this philosophy to real life.  It's obsessive.  Nothing's ever on the level anymore. A perplexed beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: George, it never was. (pause) Didn't you know that?
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. ANDY'S APARTMENT - NIGHT Arnold Schwarzenegger, in his glory days as a body-builder, on the cover of a magazine.  Magazines are everywhere.  Body- building.  Women's.  Wrestling. ANDY is sifting through them.  Zmuda watches, worried.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Look at this!  An evil Russian! Ooo, here's an evil Nazi -- he likes to fight dirty!  Hey, here's an evil Japanese guy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this, World War Two...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, I always wanted to be a bad-guy wrestler...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No offense, pal, but I just don't think you're built for it.  These he- men'll kick your ass!!  They're huge! Andy's face drops.  He realizes Zmuda's right. Beat -- then Andy notices an issue of Sumo Magazine, with a picture of a wrestler and his cute little fiance on the cover.  He slowly lifts it up, intrigued.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe I'll pick on someone smaller than me...! INT. MERV GRIFFIN SHOW - DAY CLOSE UP on Andy and Merv Griffin.  Andy wears a goofy wrestling outfit that resembles thermal underwear.  He is shouting like a wrestler.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... And I vow to continue wrestling until I am BEA TEN, in a three- minute match, with my shoulders pinned to the mat!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nonplussed) By a woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes!  BY A WOMAN! (emphatic) I'm doing this because I feel that a woman cannot beat a man in wrestling.  Even if they train with weights... it requires a certain mental ability -- (a clumsy pause) And, uh -- I just don't feel they have that... The audience MURMURS uncomfortably.  Andy laughs and backpedals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) No no!  Women are superior in many ways.  When it comes to cooking and cleaning, washing the potatoes, scrubbing the carrots, raising the babies, mopping the floors, they have it all over men.  I believe that! An appalled silence. Merv winces.  Some people start BOOING.  We can tell Andy is pleased.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) But when it comes to wrestling, forget it!  If there's a woman that can prove me wrong, come up here. I'll shut my mouth and pay her 500 dollars. Merv baitingly turns to the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any... volunteers...? WIDE All the WOMEN'S hands angrily shoot up! We move through the crowd, finally picking out... a feisty woman, LYNNE.  She mutters, half hateful, half laughing -- LYNNE I wanna kill that jerk.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. MERV GRIFFIN SHOW - MINUTES LATER Andy and Lynne stand in the ring.  She scornfully watches him preen about.  Zmuda is in a referee's uniform.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Will you please shake hands, go to your corners, and come out wrestling. Lynne extends her hand.  Andy fakes a shake -- then snidely refuses and struts away.  The crowd HISSES. DING!  It's the bell.  The match begins.  Lynne barrels at him, craving a victory, but terribly unprepared for this experience.  Andy immediately grabs her by the legs and flips her over. WHUMP!  She's down.  Andy has trained for this. Zmuda gets on his knees, watching, trying to look official. Lynne struggles and slithers away. She grabs Andy's arm and forces him down.  People CHEER. His torso hits the mat.  LOUDER CHEERS.  But suddenly he rolls over and pulls her hair!  Her head snaps back.  The crowd is INCENSED.  Zmuda hurries over and pantomimes a stern warning. Andy nods, and they separate.  They do a little dance around the ring, Lynne looking for a hole.  Suddenly, Andy spins her into a Half-Nelson.  Her arms are pinned.  They struggle, then he throws her down on her stomach.  One! Two!  Three! And DING!  It's OVER.  Andy jumps up and sneers at the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm the winner!  I've got the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! (he points at his head) Now baby, don't fight nature!  Get back in the kitchen where you belong!!! Lynne glares. Out of the blue, and old RECORDING OF BOUNCY PIANO MUSIC starts playing.  A chicken CLUCKS to the music, and Andy lip- syncs along, doing an obnoxious cock o' the walk around the ring. INT. MERV GRIFFIN SHOW, BACKSTAGE - LATER THAT DAY Lynne is escorted by a GUEST COORDINATOR.  Lynne is dazed. The Coordinator hands her a bunch of crap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here's your complimentary photo with Merv.  Here's your Turtle Wax -- LYNNE I don't need Turtle Wax.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every guest of Merv gets it.  And here's your dinner-for-two voucher at Red Lobster. Lynne takes her junk and hobbles off.  She passes Andy, who sees her and grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gosh, you scored!  Look at all those goodies!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buzz off.  Go patronize somebody else. Lynne coldly hurries away.  Andy chases after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, I hope you didn't take that stuff I said seriously.  It was just part of the show! (eager to impress) It's like the old days, when a carnival barker would try to rile up the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.  So you were just pretending to be an asshole. Andy nods, pleased.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's what I'm good at! Lynne stares -- then begrudgingly cracks a smile.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. GOLD'S GYM - DAY Jumbo-sized BEEFY MEN work out, sweating and groaning.  In a corner, Andy lifts huge barbells.  George stares, pained.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Merv Griffin has received 2000 pieces of hate mail.  Andy, Merv Griffin doesn't GET hate mail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That means it was a success.  I woke up the audience -- like punk rock! (he hands him a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) Here, take this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm not gonna take it.  If I take it I'll break my back. He crosses his arms.  Andy frowns and lowers the weight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Buddyboy, they detest you!  Next time you make an appearance, women are gonna picket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're having a laugh...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  You haven't given them any clues that it's a parody!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's because they've only seen it once.  But I'll do it again, and again, and AGAIN... (a maniacal grin) They'll catch on!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. WRESTLING RING MONTAGE OF WRESTLING MATCHES: MATCH 1 - Andy throws a FAT WOMAN to the ground. MATCH 2 - Andy squeezes a SMALL WOMAN in a headlock. MATCH 3 to MATCH 20 - Andy throws an ITALIAN LADY from the ring.  He then proudly waves a phony plastic belt over his head.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: I am the Intergender Wrestling Champion of the World!!! The crowd BOOS in disgust.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. MOVIE THEATER - DAY ANDY is at the box office, buying tickets.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Two, please. Two tickets jump out of the machine. EXT. MOVIE THEATER - DAY ANDY is standing in front, waiting.  A CAB stops and out steps -- Lynne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi... am I late?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm sure we'll be fine. Andy gives Lynne her ticket.  They enter the theater. INT. MOVIE THEATER - DAY Andy hurries up to the candy counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Popcorn?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I really want one. (at the counter) One large tub of popcorn, please, extra butter. The CANDY GIRL makes Andy his popcorn.  He pays... then heads to the exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Okay.  Let's go. Lynne is baffled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy, the theater's that way!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, I love movie theater popcorn... but that doesn't mean I have to sit through "On Golden Pond." Lynne stands in place.  Andy smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) C'mon.  We'll go for a walk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat; then she laughs) Fine. She throws down her ticket and runs after him. EXT. MOVIE THEATER, STREET - DAY They leave the theater and walk down the sidewalk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did you call me?  The last person I ever expected to get a call from was you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gosh.  Gee, Lynne... I was just so impressed with your wrestling moves. EXT. MOVIE THEATER - DAY ANDY is standing in front, waiting.  A CAB stops and out steps -- Lynne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi... am I late?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm sure we'll be fine. Andy gives Lynne her ticket.  They enter the theater. INT. MOVIE THEATER - DAY Andy hurries up to the candy counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Popcorn?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I really want one. (at the counter) One large tub of popcorn, please, extra butter. The CANDY GIRL makes Andy his popcorn.  He pays... then heads to the exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Okay.  Let's go. Lynne is baffled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy, the theater's that way!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, I love movie theater popcorn... but that doesn't mean I have to sit through "On Golden Pond." Lynne stands in place.  Andy smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) C'mon.  We'll go for a walk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat; then she laughs) Fine. She throws down her ticket and runs after him. EXT. MOVIE THEATER, STREET - DAY They leave the theater and walk down the sidewalk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did you call me?  The last person I ever expected to get a call from was you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gosh.  Gee, Lynne... I was just so impressed with your wrestling moves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were impressed with something. It's pretty odd when a man sports a hard-on that large on national television. Andy is shocked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh!  Uh, I hope I didn't offend you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm here, ain't I? A charged moment.  Andy's eyes widen.  His speech gets faster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you wanna to go to Memphis and get married?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (incredulous) Do I wanna go to Memphis and get married?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why Memphis?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he SPEAKS VERY FAST) Because Memphis is the wrestling capital of the world!  I'll go in the ring, and I'll announce that I will shave my head and marry any woman who beats me!  Then you'll come up, we'll wrestle and I'll let you win!  Then you'll scalp me, and we'll get married on Letterman, like Tiny Tim did on Carson... right there on the show!  What do you say??? Whoa.  Lynne stares into his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And all this will be for real?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a soft smile) If you want...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. MID-SOUTH COLISEUM, MEMPHIS - NIGHT The arena is filled with furious BOOING SOUTHERN WRESTLING FANS.  Ladies in hair nets.  Men clutching beer cans.  This is a rougher crowd than we've seen before. Andy stands in the ring, unshaven in a torn green robe. He's screaming at them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (screaming)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! (more BOOS)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  Show some respect!  I want
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: when I speak! People BOOO louder and throw debris.  Andy is pleased.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) If any woman can defeat me, I will pay her 1000 dollars!  Then I'll shave my head bald!  And then as a bonus -- that lucky lady will get to marry me!! Screeching JEERS and CATCALLS.  Down front... Lynne jumps up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look here, Andy Kaufman!  I'll take you on -- SISSY! The mob LAUGHS harshly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ooo, the little lady's upset.  Well I say -- get back in the kitchen!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ("outraged") No!  YOU get in the kitchen.  I'm gonna make you dry my dishes! The crowd APPLAUDS.  Lynne grins and starts to climb in the ring.  Andy's eyes are ablaze.  But suddenly -- an oversized Southern MAN jumps in and snatches the mike away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  This woman's a FAKE! She's nothing but Kaufman's girlfriend! Andy and Lynne are startled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: T-that's not true -- MAN It's a set-up!  And I won't allow our great sport to be degraded by a fix!! The crowd angrily starts to HISS.  Lynne whispers to Andy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy... who is that...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Jerry Lawler, the KING of Memphis wrestling!! (this gets HUGE CHEERS) So if Kaufman wants to tangle, I've brought a real wrestler!  She's trained and she's READY!!  Kaufman, do you think you can handle... FOXY JACKSON???!!! At that, a striking, muscular black woman stands -- FOXY. The coliseum SCREAMS with excitement.  People POUND their seats.  The roar is deafening.  Lawler gleams cockily. Lynne looks worriedly at Andy -- he's concerned.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. MID-SOUTH COLISEUM - LATER THAT NIGHT DING!  The bell rings.  Foxy comes out, ready to brawl.  But Andy remains in his corner, running down the clock.  He nonchalantly peels off his robe.  Foxy dances around impatiently.  Andy casually removes a towel from his neck. People BOO.  Still stalling, Andy then takes off his watch. People SCREAM so furiously they're red-faced.  Andy is tormenting them.  A TATTOOED GUY jumps up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Are you scared??? Andy sneers.  He cracks his knuckles, finally walks over... and commences a WINDMILL.  Absurdly, he spins his arms around and around, daring Foxy to get near him. She rolls her eyes and waits.  The REF jumps out of the way. A minute has counted down.  Finally, Andy stops -- and the real wrestling begins.  Foxy lunges at him and immediately goes for a choke-hold.  The crowd CHEERS, relieved.  Lawler motions signals.  Foxy yanks -- but Andy jerks away. Andy is intrigued.  She's coming to play!  Andy gestures to the Ref and points UP.  The Ref looks away -- and Andy SLAPS Foxy. The crowd furiously JEERS.  The Ref spins around, and Andy shrugs innocence.  He then runs at Foxy and theatrically pushes her into the ropes.  She bounces off, stumbles back - - and Andy drops to his knees.  She trips over him and hits the mat. Andy aggressively jumps onto Foxy's shoulders and pins her. The Ref counts:  One!  Two!  Three!  DING!! It's over.  But Andy stays on her, shaking his ass, leering rudely.  Jerry Lawler yells from the corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright, you won.  GET OFF HER! Andy remains, flapping his arms like a chicken. THE BOOING grows.  Louder.  More emotional.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jerry, help her!  Get in there!  Do something! Lawler hesitates -- then suddenly climbs in the ring and lifts Andy off!  Lawler angrily PUSHES Andy down. Andy is flabbergasted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: W-what are you DOING?  I don't fight men! Lawler snickers and walks away.  Completely overreacting, Andy grabs the mike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I'm gonna SUE YOU! (he starts RANTING berserkly) Let me tell you something, Lawler! I am not a hick -- I'm a national TV star!  And I DON'T like a dumb cracker pushing me around in the ring!  I never agreed to wrestle you!  So you know what I'm gonna do??? (seething) I'm gonna hire a lawyer to sue you for every cent you've got!  This was assault and battery!  In a court of law, I'm gonna kick your Southern- fried rump!!! Lawler snatches the mike and bellows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ?!  Well I got news for you, Andy Kaufman!  Wrestling is a serious sport to me!  I don't like anyone makin' fun of it, and I hate anyone insultin' the South!  So we can settle this two ways: We can go to court... or you can get in the ring with a man, and wrestle for
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Andy watches, fuming.  He is INFURIATED.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He -- can't get away with this. (to Lawler)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  You think I'm CHICKEN?! Andy grabs back the mike.  He sticks his face in shocked Lawler's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) (sarcastic SOUTHERN ACCENT) You wanna "wraaastle" me?!  You wanna "WRAAASTLE" me???  Okay, Lawler -- let's rumble!  Yeah, I've only wrestled women, but they were bigger than you!  In fact, they're probably smarter than you, 'cause you're from "Maaamphis, Taaanassee!" (back to his regular voice, he points at his head) I'm from Hollywood.  I have the brains.  That's how I win.  And Mr. Lawler, I'm gonna make you cry "Mama!" Andy bears his teeth.  Enraged, Lawler tries to take a swing at him.  HANDLERS run in and separate the angry men. EXT. MID-SOUTH COLISEUM, TUNNEL - LATER THAT NIGHT We hear NOISE from the main event above.  Andy and Lynne hurry along.  She is disgruntled.  He swaggers arrogantly, still in his fighting outfit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this an act -- or are you addicted to causing trouble??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he jokingly impersonates a drunk) I can shtop whenever I want... She's unamused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then stop treating me like a fucking prop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he drops the act) I-I'm sorry.  I got caught up in the action...! She shoots him a stern look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm warning you, Kaufman:  One morning you're gonna wake up... and your head's gonna be shaved. Andy laughs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. SHAPIRO/WEST - DAY George stares glumly at Andy.  Andy is quite cheerful -- eating a big piece of chocolate cake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Andy, do you realize you don't do comedy anymore?  Where's that sweet guy who used to do (he SINGS Mighty Mouse) "Here I come to save the day!"? (long beat) Please, enough with the wrestling! You've lost touch with reality!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (ingenuous) What, you don't think I can beat him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is the Southern Heavyweight Champion.  He'll kill you. (very disapproving) First, you piss-off women.  Then you piss-off the South.  Then you get killed! (dry) And I did the bookings. Andy shrugs, lacking a response.  He eats more cake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Andy, look... there's a job I want you to take -- guest-hosting the TV show "Fridays."  It's not so hot... but this is a great opportunity for you.  The show's live, they'll give you carte blanche, and you can get back to the business of making people laugh. Andy gets a strange gleam.  He only heard one thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said -- live? INT. FRIDAYS SET, BACKSTAGE - DAY The FRIDAYS CAST prepares.  In a corner, ANDY is arguing with director JACK BURNS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not comfortable with the last sketch.  I DON'T do drug humor!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy, it'll be fine!  It's what we're known for! (playing "stoned") "Maui?  "Wowie!"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (losing his temper) You're not listening to me -- JACK BURNS Don't worry!  The kids will love it
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he BLOWS up) But I don't do drugs!  And I don't enjoy making light of them! (YELLING) I was promised creative control! Andy storms off.  Eavesdropping cast shake their heads.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a prick! INT. FRIDAYS SET, CONTROL BOOTH - DAY Up in the control booth is -- Maynard.  He smiles strangely. INT. KAUFMAN HOUSE, FAMILY ROOM - NIGHT Stanley sits in front of his TV.  The Fridays JINGLE and CREDITS come on.  We hear dishes being washed in the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's on!  JANICE, IT'S ON! Janice rushes in, still holding some dishes. (THE FOLLOWING IS INTERCUT: Between the studio and the show on tv at Andy's parents.) INT. FRIDAYS SET - NIGHT The show is going, live.  A SNIGGERING NARRATOR steps out front.  (During his monologue, the CAMERA PANS the audience.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In this next sketch, two married couples are out to dinner.  Now... everybody has secretly brought along a joint -- (crowd WHOOPS, he grins) So, when each person leaves the table, they sneak into the restroom to get a little high... The crowd CHEERS rowdily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: JANICE I saw Michael!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. KAUFMAN HOUSE, FAMILY ROOM - SAME TIME
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (points to the set) There!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. FRIDAYS SET - NIGHT In the front row, Michael sits with a girl.  He whispers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Afterwards, I'll take you backstage. You can meet my brother. The girl smiles excitedly. The SKETCH is on a French restaurant set.  ANDY sits at a table with actor RICHARDS and actress MELANIE.  Another actress, MARY, tiptoes back over, GIGGLING stupidly, playing stoned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Gee, restaurants are amazing, aren't they?  All these strangers sitting around... stuffing dead animals in their faces!  It's just incredible!" She GIGGLES more.  The other three play baffled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "If you say so."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Excuse me, I'll be right back." Andy stands and walks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: JANICE Hmph!  They sure didn't give Andy much to do.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. KAUFMAN HOUSE, FAMILY ROOM - SAME TIME
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He said he's coming back!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. FRIDAYS SET - NIGHT Actors read the menus.  Suddenly Andy returns, a strange grin on his face.  He's swaying on his feet. The audience WHOOPS:  "Yeah!  All right!" Andy awkwardly sits.  He has a strange hesitancy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: "Gee, that bathroom is so colorf--" Suddenly he STOPS.  The actors glance up. Andy purses his lips, fretting.  An endless pause. Uh-oh.  Andy won't finish the line.  The cast looks around worriedly.  Live TV is beaming out... Finally, Melanie covers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You okay, honey?  Something wrong, Carl?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't, um... Andy shakes his head. The crowd laughs nervously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I can't play stoned. INT. FRIDAYS SET, CONTROL BOOTH - NIGHT The TECH DIRECTOR and his crew are bewildered.  They flip through script pages.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit...!  What's he doing?? But Maynard raises a calm hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay.  Stay with it. INT. FRIDAYS SET - NIGHT Silence.  Andy is torn up inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whispering to Andy) Just read the cue cards!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he shakes his head) I can't play stoned.  I feel really stupid. More silence.  The actors are trapped and upset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You feel stupid?  What about us?! The tension is awful. Unsure beat -- then fed-up Richards jumps up and storms off the set.  A CAMERAMAN hesitantly pans, confused what to do. Mary is lost.  She continues giggling, "stoned." Richards returns... with the CUE CARDS.  Irked, he dumps them over Andy's head. The crowd CHEERS stupidly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't have to do that! Andy gets enraged, grabs his prop water glass and THROWS it in Richard's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey!  CUT IT OUT!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You JERK! Melanie slaps her prop butter in Andy's hair. WIDE - Jack runs up from the floor.  He gestures at the booth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go to commercial, man! (he turns to Andy) Get off the stage!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said I didn't want to do the sketch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he JABS him)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Andy HITS Jack.  Jack recoils and SLUGS him.  They start FIGHTING. BURLY CREWMEN run in.  The crowd WHOOOOOS. Chaos.  Andy swings wildly.  The brawl goes wild.  Actors duck.  Crewmen struggle to separate Andy and Jack.  Everyone gets dragged in. IN THE AUDIENCE - Michael tries to run up and help.  A SECURITY GUY blocks him. INT. FRIDAYS SET, CONTROL BOOTH - NIGHT The tech crew is freaking out.  Maynard is oddly calm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go to three!  Eh, go to four!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: STANLEY I shoulda made him play outdoors. INT. FRIDAYS SET - NIGHT Andy and Jack are socking each other.  A FLOOR DIRECTOR screams at the top of his lungs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. KAUFMAN HOUSE, FAMILY ROOM - SAME TIME Stanley and Janice are flabbergasted.  Jaws wide. On their TV - fists are flying.  Suddenly, the BAND kicks in and the show abruptly cuts to COMMERCIAL. They stare at the TV.  Until --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We've gone to commercial!  I said,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !! Andy turns.  He notices the red lights are off -- and... instantly stops fighting.  Just like that.  Jack instantly stops too.  They glance at each other -- hold a beat -- then break into GUFFAWS.  They laugh and joyously kid each other. In the audience, Michael is STUNNED.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God --! All the commotion stops.  The audience doesn't know whether to laugh or boo.  The actors are flabbergasted -- then furious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) He's a fuckin' psycho!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't someone tell us??? Suddenly Maynard runs out of the booth, beaming.  People watch curiously. Andy seems discombobulated.  Maynard shouts out to EVERYBODY assembled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me!... I have an announcement to make!  You've all just participated in a "happening."  To make it real, some of you knew, and some of you didn't. The audience LAUGHS and APPLAUDS wildly.  The actors stare in disbelief.  One laughs hysterically.  Most are pissed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) But we don't want to upset the folks at home.  So now Andy is now going to apologize and explain that it was all a prank.  Right, Andy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (very quiet) Right...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, great!  So let's reset! Crew members start moving things around. In the audience, Michael locks eyes with Andy.  An odd, knowing moment between the brothers.  Michael whispers, getting worried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy...!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. KAUFMAN HOUSE, FAMILY ROOM - SAME TIME Stanley and Janice feel as if the commercials are lasting forever.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Why is Andy doing this?  Why?... Why? The Fridays JINGLE starts, and Andy's face fades in on the TV.  He looks directly into the camera, nervous, stiff and serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: During the commercial, the people at
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: asked me to apologize... and to tell you the truth.  They wanted me to explain that this whole fighting episode was staged... INT. FRIDAYS SET - NIGHT The sign above blinks "APPLAUSE".  The audience obediently APPLAUDS.  In the booth, Maynard grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And... um... (choking up) I can't do this. (beat)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: can't say it. (upset) It's a lie!  A cover-up! Maynard is suddenly very confused.  The crowd laughs nervously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Why are you laughing?  I'm not trying to be funny!  They threatened to fire me from Taxi, unless I gave in to their demands! (shaken) But... I won't!  Because what you saw was REAL!! INT. FRIDAYS SET, CONTROL BOOTH - NIGHT Maynard looks like he's gonna faint.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cue the commercial!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These kinds of things go on everyday at the networks, only you never see it, because they cut to commercials. (he talks extremely fast, to get in as much information before he's cut off) Now for sure they're gonna fire me, so if you want to see me again, you'll have to come to Memphis... And BLINK!  Andy gets CUT OFF. Maynard jumps up, furious.  He snaps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna STRANGLE George Shapiro! INT. KAUFMAN HOUSE, FAMILY ROOM - SAME TIME The parents stare at the commercials.  They're totally disoriented.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's in Memphis?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who knows?!  That kid is totally meshuga.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. MID-SOUTH COLISEUM, MEMPHIS - NIGHT Memphis wrestling.  The announcer stands center ring, booming into the mike.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: And now!  The MAIN EVENT of the evening!  The match you've been waiting for: The King Jerry Lawler, versus Hollywood Andy Kaufman! The THEME FROM "ROCKY" PLAYS -- and Lawler enters from the tunnel, wearing a shimmering hero's cape!  The crowd ROARS with approval. INT. MID-SOUTH COLISEUM, DRESSING ROOM - SAME TIME Andy is meditating, eyes shut, at rest in his private oasis. Suddenly -- DESPERATE BANGING on the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  Christ, you're ON! Andy awakens.  He smiles. INT. MID-SOUTH COLISEUM - NIGHT The THEME FROM "MIGHTY MOUSE" begins playing.  Then, ANDY strides in, a sneer on his grungy face.  The crowd SCREAMS and BOOS pure pile.  Andy is euphoric, loving the hatred. Down in the front row sit Stanley, Janice, Zmuda, and Lynne. Several PHOTOGRAPHERS take pictures of the parents.  They squint, unused to all this. Andy prances into the ring.  He takes the mike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before we begin this event, I just wanna say a few things to you foul people. (beat) This city is filthy!  You Southerners live like pigs!  So I'm going to teach you some lessons in hygiene... bring you out of your squalor. Holy cow.  The crowd is flabbergasted.  Women in K-mart dresses gape.  Ruddy men in trucker caps glare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Are you listening? (audience BOOS)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!! Lynne snickers.  But Stanley and Janice are ashen-faced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why is he saying these things?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're gonna lynch him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he shakes his head) Nah.  He's just engaging a passive audience. Andy reaches in his pocket and removes... a bar of SOAP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People, this is a bar of soap.  Does it look familiar to you?  If you wet it, it'll clean your hands. Stanley's eyes bulge. The crowd is enraged -- rumblings of imminent violence. Andy smiles helpfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) And now, for your next lesson: This
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is toilet paper. Andy holds up a ROLL OF TISSUE. That's it.  The crowd goes NUTS.  Jerry Lawler races over and snatches the mike, trying to maintain his dignity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kaufman, we've had enough!!  Let's you and me do what we came here for
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! INT. MID-SOUTH COLISEUM - SECONDS LATER And DING!  That's the bell!  Andy strikes a threatening pose.  Lawler takes a step forward -- and Andy instantly, cowardly, runs for the ropes and jumps out of the ring. BOOOOO!!!  Andy grins at the crowd and points at his brain: I'm smarter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) And Kaufman's left the ring! Lawler's waiting for him to return.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Zmuda) Is this a strategy? Lawler disparagingly frowns.  The REF checks his watch. Andy crosses to the opposite end of the ring, gauging his rival... then slowly climbs in -- Until the second Lawler moves.  Then Andy leaps back out!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) And Kaufman's left the ring again! He doesn't seem interested in actually making contact with his opponent. Andy struts around the floor, pointing to his brain.  He smirks at various spectators... until he finds himself face- to-face with -- his parents. An unexpected moment.  Andy's finger frozen on his brain. Janice shakes her head despairingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy, please.  Let's go home! Cameras FLASH.  The paparazzi love these moments.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry, Mom.  I'll make you proud...! Beat -- then Andy gets HIT in the head with a cup. People HOOT.  Disoriented, Andy returns to the ringside. Lawler is losing his patience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey!  Did you come down here to wrestle, or to act like an ass? Andy paces around, unsure of his next move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Look... if you get in here, I'll give you a free headlock. Lawler leans down and offers his neck. Andy peers skeptically.  People JEER.  Andy looks at waiting Lawler... then tentatively climbs in. As promised, Lawler doesn't move.  So Andy crosses over and grabs Lawler's head!  Andy grins triumphantly.  He squeezes his arms tight, muscles flexing, riding high on this moment. Until -- Lawler stands and flips him over.  Andy SLAMS DOWN on his back.  CRUNCH!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) It's a side suplex!! Andy lies on the mat, unmoving.  Lawler doesn't care.  He picks up Andy's prone body and grips it upside-down.  Janice covers her eyes.  Stanley is worried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (frantically gesturing)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  NO! Lawler disregards the Ref and slams Andy's head in a pile- driver!! A horrible THUD. DING!  The BELL immediately RINGS. JANICE opens her eyes and SCREAMS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why isn't he MOVING?? Andy's parents' reaction is a fiesta for photographers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Lawler has committed a PILEDRIVER, which is an AUTOMATIC DISQUALIFICATION!  Match goes to Kaufman by disqualification, after two minutes, twelve seconds! Andy is splayed unconscious. Raging Lawler promenades around the ring, arms over his head.  The crowd SHOUTS CRAZILY, rooting him on. Lynne runs to the ropes, SCREAMING for help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!! (frantic) Somebody get a DOCTOR!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (yelling)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !! Stanley, totally numbed, holds Janice.  They're on the verge of collapsing.  Tons of commotion.  Cameras FLASH BLINDINGLY.  A stretcher is lifted into the ring.  Andy is loaded on.  MUSIC fights the deafening NOISE. BEDLAM.  Andy is carried through the crowd, followed by his entourage.  A soft object HITS Stanley on the head. INT. MID-SOUTH COLISEUM, CORRIDOR - NIGHT Andy is being carried by the Coliseum EMPLOYEES into the dressing room.  The entourage follows.  Zmuda pushes out the crowd of REPORTERS, PHOTOGRAPHERS, and ONLOOKERS.  He slams the door and locks it. INT. MID-SOUTH COLISEUM, DRESSING ROOM - NIGHT Janice runs to Andy's side.  She's crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy!!  Are you okay?!? Andy opens his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm fine, Mom, you can calm down. A confused beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: B-but... we saw... your neck...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nah, it's phony baloney -- I faked the whole thing. (beat) It didn't hurt at all.  It was just a yoga move.  I tucked my head in. Deadpan, Andy sits up. Total silence.  Stanley stares... then a FURY comes over him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andrew -- HOW DARE YOU!!  For all we knew, you were DYING!  Look at your mother -- she's still shaking! Andy is splayed unconscious. Raging Lawler promenades around the ring, arms over his head.  The crowd SHOUTS CRAZILY, rooting him on. Lynne runs to the ropes, SCREAMING for help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!! (frantic) Somebody get a DOCTOR!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (yelling)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !! Stanley, totally numbed, holds Janice.  They're on the verge of collapsing.  Tons of commotion.  Cameras FLASH BLINDINGLY.  A stretcher is lifted into the ring.  Andy is loaded on.  MUSIC fights the deafening NOISE. BEDLAM.  Andy is carried through the crowd, followed by his entourage.  A soft object HITS Stanley on the head. INT. MID-SOUTH COLISEUM, CORRIDOR - NIGHT Andy is being carried by the Coliseum EMPLOYEES into the dressing room.  The entourage follows.  Zmuda pushes out the crowd of REPORTERS, PHOTOGRAPHERS, and ONLOOKERS.  He slams the door and locks it. INT. MID-SOUTH COLISEUM, DRESSING ROOM - NIGHT Janice runs to Andy's side.  She's crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy!!  Are you okay?!? Andy opens his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm fine, Mom, you can calm down. A confused beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: B-but... we saw... your neck...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nah, it's phony baloney -- I faked the whole thing. (beat) It didn't hurt at all.  It was just a yoga move.  I tucked my head in. Deadpan, Andy sits up. Total silence.  Stanley stares... then a FURY comes over him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andrew -- HOW DARE YOU!!  For all we knew, you were DYING!  Look at your mother -- she's still shaking!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But that's it.  I needed you to believe!  Our family will be in the newspapers.  People will look, and they'll be touched.  Because your emotions were honest! Stanley has a blank expression.  But Janice starts to cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy, I love you!  I love you, whatever you do...! She hugs Andy tightly. Andy is genuinely shocked.  He looks at his quivering mother... and then his voice softens, truly remorseful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Geez, I'm sorry.  Maybe I shouldn't have put you through all that... (quiet) Well, from now on, you'll always know the rule of thumb: Anything that happens to me... IS NOT REAL. EXT. MID-SOUTH COLISEUM - NIGHT A crowd of reporters parts.  They make way for Andy, who is carried out on the stretcher and loaded into a waiting AMBULANCE.  He is "unconscious." Cameras CLICK and FLASH.  The ambulance speeds away, siren WAILING. INT. DOCTOR'S OFFICE - DAY Andy sits watching an OLD DOCTOR examining a number of x- rays clipped to light panels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't see any injury to your neck, Mr. Kaufman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Positive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But my neck hurts... and I have a slight cough...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's probably just a strained muscle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (intent) Doctor, I think I need a neck brace. The Doctor gives up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If it makes you happy... MONTAGE OF NEWSPAPER PHOTOS: Andy in the ring, Andy outside the ring, on the floor, with his frightened parents, in a neck brace, on the stretcher, etc. INT. ANDY'S APARTMENT - DAY George, Zmuda and Andy are looking through hundreds of clippings from the newspapers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (reading aloud)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... has been rushed to a nearby hospital, where doctors are checking him for possible paralysis.  His parents are at his bedside.  Fans will best remember Kaufman as lovable Latka on television's Taxi"...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a rave!  Boy, if I ever fake my death, they'll really miss me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's working for Elvis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sarcastic) Yeah, he's just laying low, waitin' for his comeback. (he sees an article and winces) God, listen to this!  "It was morally wrong to take advantage of such an unstable individual..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow, you can't BUY this kind of publicity! George rolls his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: George, let's not drop the ball on this.  I've made some kind of cosmic career move. Somebody KNOCKS outside.  Andy jumps up, puts on his neck brace, and transforms himself into a shuffling invalid.  A DELIVERY BOY drags in an enormous basket of flowers and goodies.  Andy takes the card.  It reads "Andy, we're all praying for you.  Your friends at Taxi." Andy chuckles. EXT. ROCKEFELLER CENTER - DAY George is eating with the Saturday Night Live Producer, Lorne Michaels.  They're eating lunch in an outdoor cafe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks for seeing me on such short notice. (he takes a careful beat) I... I wanted to talk to you about booking Andy on "Saturday Night Live." Lorne Michaels squirms uncomfortably.  He chooses his words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: George -- I don't know if Andy works for our show anymore.  That wrestling stuff... is such a turnoff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We agree completely. (tactfully begging) Andy has to reconnect with his core audience.  So I got him on Letterman tonight.  He's gonna apologize to Jerry Lawler, then repent for all his bad guy shenanigans. Lorne Michaels mulls this over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's smart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's very sincere. (quietly emphatic) And he needs your show... Beat.  Lorne Michaels nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.  It'd be good to have the old Andy back.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. DAVID LETTERMAN SHOW - NIGHT Andy and Jerry Lawler are on DAVID LETTERMAN'S show.  Andy is pallid, hair shaggy, in a neckbrace and tweed jacket. Husky Lawler wears loud red pants and gold chains. Andy speaks timidly, seeming a bit dazed and regretful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: I apologize for all the wrestling I've ever done.  I'm sorry for all the abuse I've ever given... (soft) I was just playing bad guy wrestler. That's not me... it's just a role. But Jerry took it personally. Lawler and Letterman are unimpressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said some pretty inflammatory things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He thinks everything's a joke -- but it's not. (to Andy) Did you laugh when you were layin' in the hospital?? The crowd WHOOOOS. Angst flickers on Andy's sweaty face.  He stammers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: T-there wasn't a reason to purposely hurt me -- LAWLER You're a wimp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (upset) My father said I should've gotten a lawyer --!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then your father's a wimp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (losing it) And you're just poor white trash! Lawler's had enough.  Enraged, he wildly stands and SLAPS Andy. BAM! Andy crashes over and falls from his chair. THUD.  He's on the floor. Dead silence.  Everyone is astonished. They're all slack-jawed.  Even PAUL SHAFFER.  Trying to cover, Paul hurriedly kicks in with a ROCKABILLY TUNE. Andy jumps up, crazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Lawler freezes in his seat.  Letterman hides behind his desk. Andy storms over, out-of-control.  From a safe distance, he starts SCREAMING at Lawler.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: I'M SICK AND TIRED OF THIS SHIT

direction.raw_text: (cont'd)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lawler!  I WILL SUE YOUR ASS!  YOU'RE A FUCKING ASSHOLE! (he POUNDS the desk)
direction.name: direction

result.heading: I WILL GET YOU FOR THIS

direction.raw_text: !  FUCK YOU!  I WILL GET YOU FOR THIS!!! Freaked, Andy leaps up and storms out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said some pretty inflammatory things.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

He's on the floor. Dead silence.  Everyone is astonished. They're all slack-jawed.  Even PAUL SHAFFER.  Trying to cover, Paul hurriedly kicks in with a ROCKABILLY TUNE. Andy jumps up, crazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Lawler freezes in his seat.  Letterman hides behind his desk. Andy storms over, out-of-control.  From a safe distance, he starts SCREAMING at Lawler.
direction.name: direction
