direction.raw_text: (cont'd)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lawler!  I WILL SUE YOUR ASS!  YOU'RE A FUCKING ASSHOLE! (he POUNDS the desk)
direction.name: direction

result.heading: I WILL GET YOU FOR THIS

direction.raw_text: !  FUCK YOU!  I WILL GET YOU FOR THIS!!! Freaked, Andy leaps up and storms out. The crowd CHEERS rowdily. An unsure moment.  Dave glances at Lawler. Until, Andy stumbles back in.  He tries to calm himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I am sorry.  I am sorry to use those words on television.  I apologize! I'm sorry! (demented) But YOU -- you're a MOTHERFUCKING ASSHOLE!!!! Andy slams Dave's desk.  Dave jerks nervously. Crazed, Andy looks down at Dave's coffee cup.  Uh-oh. Suddenly, Andy grabs the coffee and DUMPS it on Lawler! Lawler jumps, burned.  A SECURITY GUARD runs in. Andy screams and hurtles away.  He slams open the stage door and barrels out of sight.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. LORNE MICHAELS' HOUSE - SAME TIME Lorne Michaels is watching this at home.  He gapes in disbelief.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Jesus Christ.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: ONE WEEK LATER A SMUG COMIC

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. SATURDAY NIGHT LIVE - ONE WEEK LATER A SMUG COMIC stands on stage, speaking into camera.  The show's going out live.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Hi.  Um, we were supposed to have Andy Kaufman on our show this week - - but now our producers aren't sure if it's such a good idea. (beat) Some of us at Saturday Night Live think Kaufman's a comic genius.  But others disagree... they say he's just not funny anymore. (beat) So we're putting the decision up to you.  Please call up and vote.  To keep Andy, call 1-900-244-7618.  To
direction.name: direction

result.heading: "JOKESTER ANDY KAUFMAN VOTED OFF 'SATURDAY NIGHT LIVE'"

direction.raw_text: him, call... INT. SHAPIRO/WEST - DAY Tight on Andy, staring at the LA Times.  A small headline says "JOKESTER ANDY KAUFMAN VOTED OFF 'SATURDAY NIGHT LIVE'" He is bothered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is bad... I only got 28 percent!  I'm like McGovern in
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... George sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And this wasn't "Merv."  This was the hippest audience on television. (grim) They've turned on you. At that... we reveal that SOMEONE ELSE is sitting next to Andy.  But only the back of his head is visible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) It's like you two guys wanted to destroy Andy's career!  Upsetting all those people... putting out that toxic venom... (helpless) What did you THINK would happen?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (guilty) We were just trying to push the envelope -- GEORGE You're BLIND!  There is no envelope anymore!! (beat) It hurts me to say this... but there's only one solution -- (pained) I don't want you two to ever work together again. We WIDEN... And the other person is JERRY LAWLER.  He feels bad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.  We thought it was funny...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jer', it's not your fault.  You were terrific. (sad) But maybe George is right...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's fine.  But I wouldn't have traded it for anything... (poignant) Because for one brief, shining moment... the world thought that wrestling was real. Andy gulps emotionally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll stay in touch.  Next time I'm in Memphis, I'll stop by the house, and Noreen can make me her double chocolate cake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright, buddy... (choked up) Stay good. Andy and Jerry hug. A touching beat... until Andy gets a Quixotic gleam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe I can turn it into a bit.  I can go back on the show, and say it was rigged.  Demand a recount...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy!  You don't get it! (somber) They don't want you back. Andy's face drops. INT. MEDITATION INSTITUTE UNIVERSITY, CORRIDOR - DAY The Yogi slowly walks down the corridor, deep in thought.  A few DISCIPLES IN TURBANS mill around. INT. MEDITATION INSTITUTE UNIVERSITY, CLASSROOM - DAY NINE STUDENTS, sitting in the Lotus position, are listening to a teacher.  The teacher is Andy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Open your eyes... close your eyes... open your eyes... close your eyes... open your eyes... close your eyes... Andy is repeating this faster and faster; the students are blinking their eyes faster and faster. The door opens.  The Yogi sticks his head in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, Andy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, your Holiness? The Yogi signals Andy to step out of the room. INT. MEDITATION INSTITUTE UNIVERSITY, CORRIDOR - DAY Andy steps out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is very difficult for me to say... but -- perhaps it would be best if you didn't attend the retreat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (surprised) Why??  I... I attend every year.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes -- we do not doubt your devotion to TM.  But we feel that perhaps... you and the program have grown apart philosophically. Andy is stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Philosophically"?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he sighs) The wrestling... the sexist remarks... the foul language... these things are not becoming of an enlightened individual. (beat) It seems you have no respect for anything. Andy is stupefied.  He doesn't know how to respond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course I do... The Yogi shakes his head.  Andy can't believe it.  He looks around -- men in turbans staring at him. Andy cracks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please!  You've GOT to let me take the classes!  It's how I keep myself
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is apparently not working.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So HELP ME!  All I wanna do is
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pained) Andy, don't raise your voice.  We don't wish your presence here. Andy is broken. He fights to bottle his rage -- then notices Little Wendy down the corridor, peering helplessly.  Beaten, Andy waves goodbye to her. Little Wendy gulps, then waves goodbye too.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. ANDY'S APARTMENT - DAY Middle of the afternoon, Andy lies in bed.  Covers pulled up to his face, expression glum, he's like a tragic still-life. Suddenly DING-DONG!  It's the doorbell. Andy ignores this.  Beat.  Another DING-DONG!  Then KNOCKING.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Go away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) It's me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, it's open. The door opens.  Lynne enters, holding a carton of ice cream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I brought you Haagen Dazs. Chocolate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (mournful) I don't deserve Haagen Daz.  I'm a horrible person.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy, you're not horrible.  You're just... complicated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know the real me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy... there is no real you. TIGHT - ANDY An astonished silence. And then... he slowly smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're probably right. They both giggle. Andy studies her... looking at Lynne's face, body, eyes. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you wanna move in together? Lynne smiles slyly.  She leans down and kisses him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. LAUREL CANYON HOUSE - DAY A moving van outside a funky 60's house.  MOVERS carry boxes in. INT. LAUREL CANYON HOUSE, LIVING ROOM - DAY Andy sits disoriented in the living room.  Movers bustle around him.  Mirrors get leaned against opposing walls -- and he finds himself looking into multiple reflections of himself. In the b.g., Lynne arranges some vases, then hurries out. Andy opens a box and pulls out his old Howdy Doody doll.  He smiles, then places Howdy on the shelf next to the vases. Suddenly a phone on the floor RINGS.  He grins.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Hey!  Our first phone call! (he scrambles for the phone) Hello?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Andy... it's me.  I've got some crummy news. (long beat) Taxi's been canceled. Silence. Andy has no response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (cont'd) Do you want me to come over?  Talk about it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um... no.  Uh, I'm sorta busy right now.  Thanks.  We'll get together next week. Andy hangs up.  He just sits there... confused... unsure how to react. Andy scratches his head -- then feels something odd.  He goes over to the mirror.  On the back of his neck... is an inflamed red pimple.  Andy grimaces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Yuck! INT. LA IMPROV, SHOWROOM - LATE NIGHT Very late -- a clock says 1:15.  A YOUNG COMIC is onstage, performing to the DOZEN audience members left. In back walks... Andy.  Unshaven, morose, he quietly approaches paternal owner BUDD FRIEDMAN.  Budd sees him, grins, and gives him a hearty hug.  Andy points at the stage and asks for something -- Budd eagerly nods. INT. LA IMPROV, SHOWROOM - LATER THAT NIGHT Budd is onstage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now we have a treat for you late- night diehards.  The star of Taxi -- here in person, Andy Kaufman! The sparse crowd APPLAUDS.  Budd leaves, and Andy shuffles up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, Budd, you're wrong.  I found out today that Taxi's been canceled. The crowd AWWWWS sadly.  Andy blinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Yeah, that's how I felt too... though I don't know why.  'Cause for years, all I wanted to do was get off that show. (quiet, very confessional) But now that nobody will hire me, and nobody thinks I'm funny... I guess it was probably a pretty good job. One guy LAUGHS sharply. Andy gives him a look -- thinks -- then continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Not to mention that my wife has left me.  And she took the kids. (he sighs) I don't know what I'm gonna do with myself.  My options are sorta limited... (beat) This morning, I noticed I've got a cyst, or some kind of boil, on the back of my neck.  It's really disgusting.  Look. Andy turns.  The red lump is bigger, grosser.  The crowd GROANS, revolted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) So I was thinking, since I'm sort of a quasi-celebrity, that I could charge people to touch it. (candid) Does anybody want to pay a buck to touch my cyst? A couple stoners GIGGLE and CLAP.  Andy COUGHS, then frowns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I'm serious. A pause... then a few curious people walk up to the stage. The first taker is a GOOFY BLONDE WOMAN.  She starts to reach for the cyst -- when Andy stops her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) No, no, you gotta pay first. She nods, discomforted, and reaches for her purse...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. LA IMPROV, BAR - LATER THAT NIGHT A BUSBOY sweeps up.  Budd counts money in the cash register. Andy shuffles out of the showroom.  He waves some bills.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: I made six bucks.  That's good money. Budd stares sadly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a comedy club -- not a medical sideshow. (trying to be kind) If you wanna perform here, take a shower, get some sleep, and pull yourself together.  Come back and do the material that people love: Do the Mighty Mouse, the Foreign guy! Andy, you gotta snap out of this funk!  If you can -- I'll give you the headline spot tomorrow. Andy thinks.  The wheels are spinning.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. MELROSE - DAY George is driving down Melrose, listening to the radio.  He glances at the passing marquee -- then does a doubletake. It says "ANDY KAUFMAN - 9 P.M." INT. LA IMPROV, LOBBY - THAT NIGHT Puzzled George hurries inside.  COMICS greet him: "Hey George!"  "George, you got a second?!"  George distractedly waves and moves through.  At the showroom door, he finds Budd.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Hey, what's going on here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: George, you won't believe it... I got Andy to do all the old material! (grinning) And he's killin' them! Inside, there's HUGE LAUGHTER.  George's eyes widen. Piqued, he goes in... INT. LA IMPROV, SHOWROOM - NIGHT And it's packed!  Andy is onstage, playing struggling, lovable Foreign Man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... but one ting I do not like is too much traffic.  Tonight I had to come on de freeway, and it was so much traffic... (giggling) It took me an hour and a half to get here! Foreign Man chuckles pathetically. The crowd HOWLS.  Andy's rockin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) But talking about the terrible things: My wife.  Take my -- INTERRUPTING JERK "Take my wife, please take her."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: T-take my wife, please take her... The rhythm is thrown.  A couple laughs. A flustered pause.  Andy glances down, then continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) No really, I am only foolink.  I love my wife very much.  But she don't know how to cook -- INTERRUPTING JERK "Her cooking is so bad, is terrible."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: H-her cooking... (Andy stumbles uncomfortably) Uh, cooking is so bad, is terrible. The laughs are weaker.  The act is getting wrecked. IN BACK - George grimaces.  Who the hell's doing this?? Angry, George hurries down front, looking for the loud jerk. He scans the tables... and it's Zmuda.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) But right now -- ZMUDA (AS JERK) "But right now I would like to do for you some imitations.  First, the Archie Bunker." Andy freezes up. The audience is embarrassed. A frazzled confusion, then Andy drops the accent.  He glares at Zmuda.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, do you have a problem?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, my problem is you're tired. Andy winces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was asked to do this material - -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, because your new stuff's a bunch of crap.  Kaufman, people are sick of you.  The wrestling... the hoaxes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (defensive) Hey -- that stuff gets written-up in the papers -- ZMUDA (AS JERK) Who gives a shit?!  It's not funny! GEORGE - is dumbfounded.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to himself) Why...?  Andy, why...? ON ANDY AND ZMUDA ZMUDA I used to think you were original.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was very original!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, exactly -- "was"!  But now, you're creatively bankrupt. (he gleams cruelly) In fact, Ladies and Gentlemen, Kaufman's so desperate, he PAID me to do this tonight!!  I'm a plant. It's just a fresh coat of paint on an old broken-down routine. (back to Andy) Isn't that true??? Andy shudders. The audience averts their eyes. A painful silence. "Andy Kaufman" has been destroyed. EXT. LA IMPROV - LATER THAT NIGHT Andy and George walk sadly down the street.  There is a horrible gloom over them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The world thinks Andy Kaufman sucks. So I was just giving 'em what they want...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sadly) Andy, they don't think you suck. They've just... lost a reason to love you. The guys stop walking.  George gently speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) You've gotta make the public embrace you again.  You have to win back their sympathy... ON ANDY He nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll come up with something.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. LAUREL CANYON, BEDROOM - NIGHT The telephone wakes up Lynne in the new bedroom.  She looks over -- Andy's not there.  She looks at the clock and it's 4:30 am.  She picks up the phone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Andy!!... Where are you?  I've been worried sick... NOW??... Where do you want to meet?... Okay, I'll call them... Lynne's baffled. INT. DENNY'S - DAWN Late-night Hollywood weirdos mill about.  Andy sits with bleary Lynne, Zmuda, and George.  Zmuda admires the menu.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at that Grand Slam!  Two eggs, two bacon, two sausage, two pancakes
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: $2.99!  How do they do it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They get you on the coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (irritable) Excuse me -- but could Andy tell us why we're here??? All heads turn.  A long pause. Then -- Andy stiffly speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have cancer. Beat.  Zmuda nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, that's good!  We can make that play. (spitballing) And we'll really drag it out.  You get better, you get worse... you die...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  It's in terrible taste! I want nothing to do with this. Pause.  Lynne is puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy, are you serious?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (grinning) Serious like a heart attack!  Hey, maybe I can push you around in some goofy wheelchair! Andy softly shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it's true.  I have lung cancer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's ridiculous.  You don't even smoke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (emphatic)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got some freaky rare kind. It's called large-celled carcinoma. Lynne's eyes tear up.  She hugs onto Andy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, Andy!  Can they cure it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They don't know... they've gotta run more tests.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (starting to cry) Have you told your family?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, NO!  Not yet.  I feel bad -- I've jerked 'em around so many times. George and Zmuda glance skeptically at each other.  Hmm... Confused, George leans in to Andy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy... you look me in the eye, and tell me this is true. Andy gulps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: George -- it's true. INT. DENNY'S BATHROOM - NIGHT George confronts Zmuda.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I find out you're behind this, I'll kill you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are ya TALKIN' ABOUT?!  I was the one saying I didn't believe it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly.  That's the sort of thing you guys would work out to fuck me up. INT. LAUREL CANYON HOUSE - DAY Andy is doing laundry.  He empties the clean clothes, puts them in a basket, and carries them to the rug.  Then he sits down and starts laying out pairs of socks in highly symmetrical patterns.  Focused, impassive, Andy pointlessly orders the socks like the world depended on it. Lynne enters, emotionally wrecked.  She stares in frustration at Andy's behavior.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can you be so casual??!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he shrugs) Even if I'm dying -- I still need clean socks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're NOT DYING!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.  You're probably right. He keeps working.  Lynne loses it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God, you're so detached!! Lynne storms out. Andy finishes his socks.  Satisfied... he turns on the TV. ON THE TV: It's "Lassie."  Little TIMMY is laid-up in bed, with a broken leg.  Suddenly LASSIE runs in, holding a book. Lassie places the book on his lap.  The boy smiles gratefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, girl.  You're my best friend. Timmy warmly embraces the dog. ANDY - is terribly touched.  Tears start rolling down his face. Genuine sobbing.  Terrible grief, until he wipes his cheeks. Andy collects himself, then reaches for a phone.  He dials a long number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (on phone) Dad...?
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. CEDARS SINAI, RADIATION ROOM - DAY ANDY lies under the machine.  It bombards his body with powerful radiation. INT. CEDARS SINAI, DOCTOR'S OFFICE - DAY The whole Kaufman family is gathered.  Stanley, Janice, Michael and Carol listen to a BLAND DOCTOR in a white coat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The cancer started in Andy's left arm and spread to his lungs.  We've initiated an aggressive radiation program... see if we can eradicate the affected cells. (his BEEPER goes off) Excuse me.  I'll be right back. The doctor leaves.  A somber silence -- and then Janice bursts into tears.  Stanley hugs her tightly. Carol watches the doctor with great hostility.  His old tennis shoes are grabbing her attention.  He leaves, and she frowns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a crock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (angered) How dare you make light of this!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad, I cried when he broke his neck. He's not gettin' me again -- STANLEY (impassioned) Jesus!  He's got lung cancer! A standoff moment.  Carol loses it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, that's exactly it!  He picked lung cancer, because he doesn't smoke.  That makes it weird!  If he'd picked leukemia, it'd be totally believable, and we'd all be going, "Poor Andy, he's really sick."  So he chose lung cancer, because he WANTS us to be scratching our heads, saying, "Is this real?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (trying to convince herself) Of course it's real.  We're in a hospital...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom, it's Cedars-Sinai!  It's a showbiz hospital!  Andy's studio friends probably run this place!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He plans these things out.  He takes over, hires actors... (beat) Personally, I didn't think that "doctor" was very convincing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you notice his costume had the wrong shoes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (excited) Yeah!  He didn't have doctor shoes! A moment of total silence.  All four of them look at each other.  Is there... a glimmer of hope?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We all know he's talked about faking his own death...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure -- but what if he isn't? (sad; poignant) My son could be dying... and we're actin' like we're on Candid Camera.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. LAUREL CANYON HOUSE - DAY George pulls up in his convertible.  He jumps out. He walks to the door and starts to knock -- when suddenly it creeps open.  It's Lynne, putting her finger to her lips: Shh! INT. LAUREL CANYON HOUSE, LIVING ROOM - DAY The house is dark.  Lynne leads George into the shrouded living room... and Andy is sitting in a Lotus position, concentrating.  In front is a WILD-HAIRED MAN in a purple robe.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: I want you to visualize.  Visualize big, healthy white cells in your body.  Now visualize little cancer cells.  Now those big white cells are attacking the cancer cells...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see them... I see the white cells... In the corner -- George stares.  He's fighting his skepticism.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. LAUREL CANYON HOUSE, LIVING ROOM - LATER THAT DAY The drapes are open.  Sunlight streams in.  Andy hugs the teacher goodbye, and the man leaves. George has been waiting in back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: What was that all about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's visualization therapy.  He's helping me turn inward and fight the disease. Long beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's an actor.  I remember him in "The In-Laws." Ah.  Andy's eyes widen.  His wheels are spinning fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, yes... that's true.  But he's also ordained in holistic medicine. ON GEORGE - He glares, stewing.  George is fed up. ON ANDY - An unspoken tension.  Then suddenly, he breaks down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) George, what am I supposed to do?! I'm sick, and I'm tryin' to get better... but everyone's lookin' at me funny!  Even you come to my home and act like I'm puttin' on a skit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must take a little pleasure in it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course! (beat) But that doesn't mean I don't need everyone's support!  I can't be surrounded by negative energy. George shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy, you're surrounded by what you create.  You are the KING of negative energy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (thrown) Y-yeah?  Well, then it has to stop! Because if these bad vibes get out... then everyone will be talkin' about how sick I am, and it becomes a self-fulfilling prophecy, and then
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm dead. Andy struggles to remain composed.  George sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So how can I help you...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanna go back to work and put on a happy show. (bright-eyed) The best show anybody's ever seen!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you wanna tour the clubs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No clubs.  I wanna reach the TOP! (beat) Carnegie Hall...! George gently smiles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. NATIONAL ENQUIRER OFFICES - DAY A STAFF meeting at the National Enquirer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: #1 I'm working on a great cover story: I've got a guy in the lab at Cedars. He says Andy Kaufman is dying of lung cancer. Beat.  The room GROANS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What bullshit!  No.  No more Kaufman stories!  He's burned us too many times!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #2 Yeah, he's definitely not dying. He's playing Carnegie Hall next month! The Reporter frowns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #1 Jesus.  Only Kaufman would use cancer as a publicity stunt. INT. LAUREL CANYON HOUSE - NIGHT A 16mm PROJECTOR runs a scratchy 1930's movie short on the wall.  Smiling fake COWBOYS and COWGIRLS dance, the cowgirls straddling hobby horses.  They all SING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "I've got spurs That jingle-jangle jingle..." WE WIDEN Andy, George and Zmuda watch.  Andy's face is enthralled like a kid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is great.  The crowd's gonna love this! (giddy; thinking) Hey... do you still think any of those cowgirls are still alive?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno.  If they were, they'd be pushin' 80.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, call SAG.  It'd be cool to get one on the show. (excited) I want the evening to build and build.  It's gonna have the most incredible ending: Singers, dancers, the "Hallelujah Chorus" -- then the sky opens, and Santa Claus comes flying down!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you say, "Santa, what am I gettin' for Christmas?"  And he says, "Cancer!"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!  NO NO NO!  None of that!  I want this show to be positive!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's great... but this show's gonna cost a fortune.  Even if it sells out, you'll still lose eighty grand. Andy smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care about the money.  I just want the show to deliver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So who's gonna pay for it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tony Clifton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat) You know Tony doesn't have that kind of money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then he'll borrow it.  I know Tony better than you do.  Even if he has to work another ten years to pay it off, he'll do it! Pause.  George considers this -- then slowly nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, Andy.  Will do.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. CEDARS SINAI - DAY Andy silently sits.  The doctor and two NURSES administer a chemo drip into Andy's body. He stares at the needle in his arm. The chemo begins.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. CARNEGIE HALL - NIGHT A dressy NEW YORK CROWD pushes into Carnegie Hall.  The marquee says "ANDY KAUFMAN." INT. CARNEGIE HALL - LATER THAT NIGHT The show is on.  Andy effusively PLAYS his conga drum and SINGS nonsense words to "Allouette, Gentille Alloutte."
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Abbu daba, abi abbu daba!  Abbu daba, abu dabu do! (to the crowd) Abbu dabbu da ba do...! Everyone repeats.  In the audience, George sings along too.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: AUDIENCE ABBU DABBU DA BA DO

direction.raw_text: A ba du ba ti la ma na go!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... LA... MA NA GO...
direction.name: direction

result.heading: AUDIENCE A BA DU BA TI

direction.raw_text: (grinning) Abbu da ba du ba ti lama na gobo abi tabu la!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... The crowd hopelessly breaks out LAUGHING. ANDY laughs along.  They're all having a good time. INT. CARNEGIE HALL - LATER THAT NIGHT The corny "Jingle Jangle Cowboy" MOVIE is playing on a big screen.  It finishes.  Beaming Andy grabs the mike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ladies and Gentlemen!  I'm pleased to announce that we have with us the one surviving cowgirl from that 1931 film, Eleanor "Cody" Gould!! Crazed APPLAUSE.  Frail ELEANOR GOULD, 75, comes onstage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) It's such an honor to have you here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (squinting into the lights) Andy... this is so overwhelming...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it's gettin' even better! 'Cause we found one of the original hobby horses!  Do you -- do you think you could treat us to a few steps from "Jingle Jangle Jingle"? Eleanor starts to protest -- but Andy hands her the HOBBY HORSE.  She blushes.  Andy turns away, goes to the band, and starts conducting.  They begin to PLAY "JINGLE JANGLE JINGLE."  Eleanor awkwardly starts dancing in circles. Andy gets excited and conducts FASTER.  Eleanor is sweating. She dances faster. Andy impatiently SPEEDS UP the MUSIC MORE.  Eleanor desperately skips in circles, trying to keep up... when suddenly she grabs her heart. Eleanor stops -- and collapses.  She's down. A horrified GASP from the crowd.  The band stops playing. CREW MEMBERS run on from backstage.  One checks her heart. She's not moving.  Zmuda runs out, horrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is there a doctor in the house??! The crowd is stunned silent.  Pause -- then one man stands. It's Michael. Straight-faced, he hurries out of his seat, sprints down the aisle, and goes on stage.  Michael checks her pulse and loosens her blouse.  He presses Eleanor's chest, trying to restart her heart.  But then -- he shakes his head sadly. She's dead. The crowd MOANS sadly.  Michael covers Eleanor with a jacket. INT. CARNEGIE HALL, BACKSTAGE - NIGHT Andy watches, pleased.  Suddenly, he COUGHS harshly.  Andy drinks some water.  Pause... then he puts on a goofy Indian headdress and runs back out. INT. CARNEGIE HALL - NIGHT Eleanor lies dead.  Andy skips over and starts doing an Indian war dance around her body.  The crowd is baffled. Andy WHOOPS, he CHANTS... and then Eleanor starts to rise! He WHOOPS triumphantly.  She lives, like Frankenstein reborn!  The crowd CHEERS, surprised and giggling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ladies and Gentlemen, she's alive! Huge APPLAUSE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  HALLELUJAH!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ladies and Gentlemen, the Mormon Tabernacle Choir!!! Rear curtains part, and the MORMON TABERNACLE CHOIR belts out the "Hallelujah Chorus"! It's spectacular.  The crowd goes nuts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Oh my gosh, it's the Rockettes! Yes indeed, TWO DOZEN ROCKETTES rush in from the sides, legs kicking high. The crowd WHOOS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Girls and Boys, it's Santa Claus!! Snow start falling, and SANTA ON HIS SLEIGH drops from above. The crowd screams with excitement.  It's unbelievable.  They leap to a standing ovation. In front are Stanley and Janice.  They start crying. Beaming Andy embraces Eleanor.  Then he takes the mike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) And it's not over yet!!  'Cause I'm taking you all out to Milk and Cookies!! The crowd laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I'm serious!!!!!!! EXT. CARNEGIE HALL - MINUTES LATER A thousand people file out -- and THIRTY-FIVE SCHOOLBUSES are parked up and down Fifth Avenue!!!  The crowd is AWED. Andy euphorically marches out, pushing his endurance.  He's the Pied Piper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Single file!  Don't rush!  There's enough cookies for everyone!! EXT. ELEMENTARY SCHOOL - LATER THAT NIGHT The schoolbuses pull up to a school.  The disoriented passengers step out, not sure what to expect... INT. ELEMENTARY SCHOOL, CAFETERIA - NIGHT The audience crowds inside... and LADY CAFETERIA WORKERS in hairnets are dispensing milk and cookies.  It's remarkable. At a little kids table sit Andy and Lynne.  Andy's face is pure joy.  He watches all the adults munching on their cookies, everyone giddy at the silliness of it all. Andy smiles beautifully.  He squeezes Lynne's hand, then whispers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want this to ever end... EXT. NEW MEXICO DESERT - DAY A stucco SPA RESORT sits in the middle of the rocky desert. INT. SPA - SAME TIME A room with soft lighting and billowing curtains.  A New Age HEALER is laying crystals upon Andy's body. Andy COUGHS.  His hat is off, revealing he's bald.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now we'll place a blue crystal. Very high vibrations.  It's wonderful for it's healing powers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (spellbound) Okay.  Let's try two of those... and one of the pink ones. EXT. SPA - DAY Zmuda stands with a swarmy ADMINISTRATOR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your friend is doing four crystal sessions a day, but it's just not helping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know... (beat) The cancer's terminal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  That wasn't made particularly clear to us when he checked in...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (irked) Look, personally, I think rubbing rocks on people is a load of horseshit.  But if it makes Andy happy, that's all that matters. The man purses his lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry to sound crass -- but we don't want to be "that health resort in New Mexico where Andy Kaufman died." (beat) I'm going to have to ask you to leave. Zmuda is speechless. INT. SPA, ANDY'S ROOM - LATER THAT DAY Zmuda angrily packs Andy's bags.  Zmuda is seething. But Andy is strangely calm and unaffected.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay, Bob.  It wasn't really working. (a gentle smile) We'll find something better. INT. LAUREL CANYON HOUSE, KITCHEN - DAY Lynne and Little Wendy are cooking Andy lunch.  Lynne mashes up strange unidentifiable plant products.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this stuff?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all macrobiotic.  Millet, burdock root, kelp... Andy says it'll purify him. Suddenly -- a SHARP VOICE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) What is that crap?  Looks like somethin' my dog would puke up!! The women turn.  It's Andy -- dressed as Tony Clifton. A spooked moment. Tony's wig, peach tux, and sunglasses are there... but Andy is barely strong enough to bark out the attitude.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How 'bout me and you dolls go get some REAL food:  French fries and a Porterhouse steak!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (not sure what to say) ...Andy...? Little Wendy's eyes pop:  Oh no she broke the rule!  Tony gets very indignant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't Andy!  I'm Tony!  Andy's sick -- pick, chick, kick, lick! The doctor says he's a goner. (rousing himself) But Tony's built like a mule!  Andy asked me to be his pallbearer!  I'll do it for him!  I'm getting stronger and stronger!  Here, watch this! Tony picks up a CHAIR and starts lifting it:  Up, down, up, down.  Worried, the women rush to stop him.  They take the chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it!  C'mon, put that down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, you're right.  We better get movin'.  We don't wanna miss Happy Hour at Kelbos -- all the Mai Tai's you can drink for $4.99. Tony jauntily turns to exit.  He gestures to the ladies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Let's go! (he starts SINGING "New York, New York") "These vagabond blues, Are washin' away. I'll make a brand new start of it..." Tony reaches the doorway -- and collapses. He clutches himself in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy!! Shocked, they run over. Tony lies huddled on the ground.  He mutters sadly, defeatedly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dammit...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. LAUREL CANYON HOUSE - DUSK The sun is setting, purple and orange over the hills.  Andy and George lie on chaise lounges, serenely staring out. Andy has a blank look on his face, and has lost more weight. He is a shadow of himself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: I can't move my arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (awkwardly) You've got good days and bad days. Andy softly sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My hair is coming out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whispers) Yeah... George silently pats Andy.  Andy's energy is sapped, but he forces himself to be upbeat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got an idea for a new TV show for me to star in.  It's called "Uncle Andy's Fun House" -- it'll be a Saturday morning thing where I can goof off with the kids.  You know, puppets, magic tricks... George is choked up.  He goes along with it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (long pause) I think we can sell that. Silence. George struggles not to shatter Andy's enthusiasm. Andy smiles gratefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey... thanks for always backin' me. George clenches Andy's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did your -- doctor say it's okay for you to go back to work?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ehhh, you know those guys.  If he had his way, I'd be stuck in the hospital, running tests all day. (beat) And anyway, I've found a new guy who's gonna be able to instantly remove the cancer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (startled) Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah!  He's a psychic surgeon in the Philippines, and he's amazing!  He rubs you and sucks the disease right out! Andy beams.  George stares sadly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Philippines?  I dunno... Andy... he sounds like one of your characters. TIGHT - ANDY His voice gets hushed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... this guy's special. (very sincere) He performs miracles. George doesn't know how to respond. Andy looks up pleadingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) He's my last chance.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. BAGUIO CITY, PHILIPPINES - DAY Baguio, a tiny scratched-in-the-dirt Philippine city. Suddenly, a rattletrap COMMUTER PLANE lurches out of the sky.  It hits a dirt runway.  Dust flies.  Chickens squawk and run. INT. BEAT UP TAXI, PHILIPPINES - DAY Andy, Lynne, and Zmuda ride through the impoverished city. Andy stares in amazement. EXT. CLINIC, PHILIPPINES - DAY They reach a brick building.  A sign says "CLINIC," with an eye over a triangle. INT. CLINIC, PHILIPPINES - DAY A NURSE hurriedly helps weakened Andy sign a bunch of forms. Money is handed over. Andy's clothes are stripped off.  They're thrown in a locker. INT. CLINIC OPERATION ROOM, PHILIPPINES - DAY A large white tiled room.  Lynne and Zmuda roll in pallid Andy, his limp body unmoving. Andy looks up... and there's a LONG LINE OF SICKLY PEOPLE. Primarily Japanese, emaciated, all stripped to their underwear and barely able to stand. They have a look of desperation and reverence. At the head of the line is JUN ROXAS at his work station: A bench, a sink, and ATTENDANTS with clean towels. A SICKLY WOMAN crawls onto the bench.  Jun impassively presses his hand into the fatty flesh of her stomach, kneading, searching.  Pause, then he removes some BLOODY GUTS. He flings them into a bucket. The woman cries out. Andy gasps. The woman is helped away. Jun turns to wash his hands.  An attendant gives him a towel to dry with.  Then a SICKLY MAN crawls up... Andy rolls closer.  He stares at all this with fear. Nervousness.  Hope. Jun impassively presses his hand against the man's head.  He concentrates, searching... then pulls out some BLOODY GUTS. He flings them into a bucket. The man shakes.  He is helped away. Andy is wide-eyed.  He gets closer... closer... More patients.  More bloody guts.  More sobbing. Andy's excitement builds. Then -- he reaches the front. A moment. Lynne and Zmuda stare into Andy's eyes, drawn in by his total belief.  They are overcome.  It feels like they're saying goodbye.  Lynne gives Andy a tender kiss.  Zmuda starts to shake his hand -- and instead hugs him tightly. Andy smiles, then the attendants lift him from the wheelchair.  They help him up to the bench. Andy lies down.  Fluorescent lights buzz overhead. He looks over, and Jun Roxas is washing his hands from the previous patient. Andy shivers, anticipating the miracle. Jun turns.  An attendant gives him a towel to dry off. Andy relaxes, readying for it all... He glances at Jun's hands.  Jun hands back the towel -- and under it the attendant quickly slips Jun a sack of animal intestines. Jun discreetly palms it.  He's a fake. CLOSEUP - ANDY A moment of stunned disbelief. He is shocked.  Outraged.  Disappointed.  Flabbergasted. The faith is meaningless.  The joke is cosmic.  The con man has been conned. Andy's overpowering emotions coalesce... and he starts to LAUGH. It's sidesplittingly funny.  Andy LAUGHS, and LAUGHS, and LAUGHS, like a crazy man with no salvation, the joy releasing him, the tears rolling down his cheeks. His face flushes with color.  Life sparkles in his eyes. Andy laughs and guffaws until he's hoarse.  This is the best gag of them all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. FUNERAL HOME - DAY Andy lies in peace in a casket.  He has died. His expression is pleasantly bland.  Almost Latka-like.  But his face is caked with so much funeral-home makeup, it almost looks like a mask. We slowly widen.  The casket is surrounded by beautiful flowers.  We TILT UP... and high above... is a MOVIE SCREEN. On the SCREEN is a projection of Andy, silently staring at us.  There's a gentle smile on his face.  It's the image from the opening of this film. ANDY'S POV: The chapel is filled with GRIEVING MOURNERS. All are in black.  Everyone's quiet, in a state of shock. Andy's family is huddled. Lynne sits alone in a pew, crying. George gives Zmuda a hug.  Little Wendy comes over... and they comfort each other. Everyone who ever knew Andy is there: Taxi cast, Fridays cast, TM followers, hookers, Jerry Lawler, Ed Weinberger, Maynard Smith, Budd Friedman, it goes on and on... And -- they all have odd discombobulated expressions.  They stare up at the PROJECTED ANDY.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Well... My show is over.  I did my best, and I just want to say, until we meet again... please remember: (he begins to SING) "In this friendly, friendly world... With each day so full of joy. Why should any heart be lonely." Some gathered people tentatively join in the SINGING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) So everybody!  Put your arm around the person next to you, even if you don't like that person.  Come on! (he resumes SINGING) "The world is such a wonderful place, To wander through, When you've got someone to love, To wander along with you. With the sky so full of stars, And the river so full of songs, Every heart should be so thankful, Thankful for this friendly, friendly world..." The curtain behind the coffin OPENS and the casket with Andy's body slowly slides into the DARKNESS. The curtain closes.  The FILM ENDS. And all goes silent. Some people cry.  Some begin to leave.  Most of them are just staying, numbed. George and Zmuda whisper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a perfect Kaufman audience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.  They don't know whether to be sad, or angry. The Taxi cast are flustered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are people leaving?  The curtain's gonna open.  Andy's gonna come out... I know it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, the body was just made of wax...! (a very long beat) Wasn't it......? Silence.  They look to the front. The closed curtain wafts... then settles motionless.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . FADE IN: EXT. SUNSET BLVD./COMEDY STORE - NIGHT A SUPER slowly appears:  "EXACTLY ONE YEAR LATER" On Sunset, TWO DUDES come riding along on skateboards. Suddenly they reach -- INSANITY.  Traffic on Sunset is jammed.  HONKING limousines jockey to squeeze by. Confused, one Dude squints into the distance -- and his eyes pop.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: #2 Oh my GOD. (stupefied) That's the freakiest thing I've ever seen!!  Look! He points.  His friend turns -- and gasps. AT THE COMEDY STORE - The marquee says "TONY CLIFTON: LIVE!"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #1 Man, we were right!  He's not dead!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #2 He's just been lyin' low for a year!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Hysterical, the guys race up to the club.  But outside, there's a CRAZED, PULSING MOB.  People are screaming. Police have barricades.  Everybody cries to get in. INT. COMEDY STORE - SAME TIME It's packed.  Every square inch is filled with glittery Hollywood VIPs.  People make chit-chat... but there is a squeamish excitement in the air.  A brooding unease.  Nobody knows what to expect. Suddenly -- the lights go black.  A BOOMING ANNOUNCER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Ladies and Gentlemen!  Please put your hands together for... Tony Clifton! The THEME FROM 2001 starts playing.  "DAAAAA, DAAAAA, DAAAAA!  DA-DAAAAA"! A small SPOT appears -- on a peach tuxedo.  The light grows bigger, bigger... the tension magnifying... people gasping... our view widening... until Tony Clifton is revealed onstage! It's an extraordinary theatrical moment -- without response. The crowd has no idea what to do. Tony smirks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How ya doin'? Dead silence. Tony struts downstage.  He waves to the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) How you doin' back there?! (to the front rows) How you doin' up here?! Still no response.  Until -- a lone reckless VOICE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy! Whoa.  The crowd rustles nervously. Tony grimaces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't know nothin' about no Andy. Just some dead guy tryin' to ride my coattails. (to the BAND) Let's HIT IT, boys!  One, two, anda one two three four! The BAND kicks in with disco anthem "I WILL SURVIVE."  Tony starts SINGING the schmaltzy opening:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) "First I was afraid I was petrified. Kept thinkin' I could never live Without you at my side." (he wipes away a pretend tear) "Were you the one that tried to Hurt me with goodbye? Did you think I'd crumble? Did you think I'd lay down and Die...?" We PAN the room full of enthralled spectators.  At a front table are George and Lynne. Tony attacks the chorus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) "Oh no not I!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! As long as I know how to love, I know I'll simply stay alive!" In the crowd, we pass face after face -- smiling... frowning... intrigued... confused... until we settle on a man in the very last row. Bob Zmuda. Enjoying the show more than anyone.
direction.name: direction
